tables.name: valsi
tables.schema: ++id, bangu, w, d, n, t, *s, g, *r, *cache

rows.d: $x_1$ is a room, building unit for purpose $x_2$
$x1=t1$ is a plaque of material $x2=t2$, commemorating $x3=s3$
Process/event $x_1$ (nu/pu'u) unfolds slowly.
$x_1=b_5$ is the means/medium by which $x_2=b_1$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_3=b_2$ to receiver $x_4=b_3$ from transmitter/origin $x_5=b_4$.
rows.n: {benji} with $x_5$ promoted by means of {xo'ai}, resulting in a different place structure from the otherwise identical {xelbe'i} ({xe} {benji}).
rows.g: means of transfer;means of transmission;medium of transfer;medium of transmission

rows.d: $x_1$ is a barrel/cylindrical container of material $x_2=s_2$ containing $x_3=v_2$
rows.n: See also {slanu} and {vasru}. This word does not imply the barrel is wooden, it could apply to any cylindrical containment tool.

rows.d: $m_1=s_1$ is a top hat [cylindrical hat] made of material $m_2=s_2$.
rows.g: beaver hat;chimney pot hat;cylinder hat;high hat;silk hat;stove pipe hat;top hat

rows.d: $x_1$ is a tower for purpose $x_2$.
$x_1$ rolls up material (usually sheet) $x_2$ into cylindrical/tube shape.
rows.g: roll into cylinder;roll into tube;roll up

rows.d: $x_1$ (abstract) is a color
$g_1$ pickles $st_1$ with acid $sl_1$
$c_1=s_1$ is acid rain raining on/to $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_1$ (predication) is necessary.
rows.n: $x_1$ is true in all possible worlds. Equivalent to operator $L$ from modal logic. See also {zilcu'i}, {bi'ai}, {mu'ei}, and {ka'e}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (zoi quote) is $x_2$ moras/morae in 'weight' (default: 1) by standard $x_3$.
rows.g: be X moras in weight;measure in moras

rows.d: $m_1$ is dimoraic/is the mass of two morae formed from set of morae $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$m_1$ is monomoraic/is the mass of one morae formed from set of morae $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$m_1$ is trimoraic/is the mass of three morae formed from set of mora $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$p_1$ is a mora [linguistics]/component of syllable $p_2=s_1$ in language $s_2$.
rows.n: A syllable containing one mora is said to be monomoraic (={pavyslakypau}); a syllable with two morae is said to be bimoraic (={relslakypau}). Also, in rarer cases, a syllable with three morae is said to be trimoraic (={cibyslakypau}).

rows.d: $m_1$ (sance) is (in)/occupies the nucleus of syllable $s_1=m_2$.
$x_1$ contains $x_2$ (number) syllables.
$x_1$ is ornamentation which exhibits the property of being or being similar to millefiori, and which adorns $x_2$ and has composition/arrangement/pattern $x_3$
rows.n: This word is equivalent to {mlirumjvesimjonxonslanybafkemclenykukrypaxryja'i} and uses the same veljvo (including experimental ones).

rows.d: $x_1$ rejoices/is-joyful in/about $x_2$ (event/state)
$x_1$ gives $x_2$ to $x_3$ in celebration of $x_4$ (event).
The property $x_1$ is rare/unusual/uncommon among $x_2$
$x_1$ (agent) insults $x_2$ with insult $x_3$ (text / sedu'u)
$x_1$ (agent) affirmatively consents to $x_2$ (agent) performing/causing action/event/state $x_3$; $x_1$ communicates their consent to $x_2$ regarding $x_3$.
rows.n: Nearly synonymous with {tolprosku}. See also {tolpro} 'give consent', {nuntolpro} 'consent' (state/action), {skukemtolprogletu} 'have sex by affirmative consent'.
rows.g: affirmatively consent;communicate consent;give affirmative consent;give consent

rows.d: $t_1$ is a manner of expression of $c_1$, saying $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
$x_1=c_1=s_1$ responds to $x_2=s_2$ by expressing/saying $x_3=c_2$ to $x_4=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_5=c_4$.
$x_1$ is a speech act, characterized by speaker $x_2$ uttering text $x_3$ to listener/audience $x_4$, for purpose $x_5$

$x_1=s_1$ drives vehicle $x_2=m_1$ illegally according to people/culture/judges/prosecutor $x_3=z_2$ under influence of $x_4=xl_1$ (agent/property/substance) which affects driving with effect $x_5=xl_2$.
$x_1$ suggests, tempts $x_2$ (assertion) into recipient $x_3$
$m_1=c_1$ expresses/states an order to $m_2=c_3$ for $m_3$ (event/state) to happen.
$g_1$ has sex with $g_2$ with affirmative consent; $g_1$ and $g_2$ have affirmatively consensual sex.
rows.n: The people involved have communicated their consent to one another. Effectively synonymous with {tolproglesku}.
rows.g: affirmatively consensually fuck;have affirmatively consensual sex

rows.d: $x_1$ means to say $x_2$ but mistakenly says $x_3$ instead.
$d_1$ means/intends to say $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$.
$x_1$ is folded/creased at loci $x_2$.
$x_1$ is metalinguistic with respect to the expression by $x_2$ of text $x_3$ for audience $x_4$ via medium $x_5$ .
$x_1$ has probability $x_2$ of occurring.
$x_1$ is a vine of genus/species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is September of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$m_1$ is an aerial tramway carrying $m_2$ in/on lift $m_3$, propelled by $m_4=s_1$.

$x_1=c_1$ is a bow/crossbow/ballista for shooting ammunition $x_2=c_2$ [arrow/quarrel/crossbow bolt] by flexing and releasing bow/prod/lath $x_3=g_1$ of material $x_6=g_3$, to whose two ends are tied bow string $x_4=g_2=s_1$ of material $x_5=s_2$.
rows.n: To be clear, the launch mechanism is as follows: $x_4$ is pulled so as to bend $x_3$, while $x_2$ is placed on $x_4$, and $x_4$ is released, causing $x_3$ to snap back into its normal shape, launching $x_2$ as it does so.

rows.d: $b_1=c_1$ is a heifer [young female cattle/beef-producer/bovine], of age $n_2$, immature/defined as a heifer by standard $n_3$, of species/breed $b_2$.
$x_1=p_1=s_1$ uses book $x_2=c_1$ about/containing $x_3=c_2$ by author $x_4=c_3$ for audience $x_5=c_4$ preserved in medium $x_6=c_5$ in order to explain $x_7=s_2$ to $x_8=s_3$.
$t_1=xl_1$ is bad weather at place/region $t_2$ for $x_3=xl_2$ by standard $x_4=xl_3$.
$u_1=s_1$ is a tooltip describing $s_2$ to $s_3$ with description $s_4$ in user interface $u_2$.
$x_1$ is terrible for $x_2$ in aspect  $x_3$
$z_1$ is an engineer in the branch of $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$ with purpose/goal $z_3$
$x_1=st_1$ is a laboratory [workplace for the conduct of scientific research] for studying science $x_2=sa_2$.
$p_1$ is a scientist pertaining to science $s_1$ about subfield $s_2$
$x_1=k_1$ is a laboratory [room] for studying science $x_2=s_2$.
rows.n: Limited to rooms only. For the general workplace, see {skestu}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a scientific journal with articles $x_2$. $x_2$ is a research article in journal or proceedings $x_1$.
$c_1$ is science/technology-oriented science fiction about plot/theme/subject $c_2$ by author $c_3$, based on science $s_1$.
$x_1$ is a peacock/peahen of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ resembles $x_2$ in color $x_3$
$t_1=x_1$ is the worst among set/range $t_4$ for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.

$x_1$ is an improperly-created/wrongly-proposed/illy-proposed lujvo with intended meaning $x_2$ but actual interpretation/built from metaphor $x_3$, due to/with error $x_4$ in its rafsi $x_5$, which is unacceptable to $x_6$ by standard $x_7$, in language $x_8$
rows.n: Notice that terbri structure and conditions of error are not referenced in the terbri of this word. The error could be simply failing to be the highest-scoring lujvo available (for a given tanru) by some algorithm/standard; however, it could also be the product of a certain unintentionally wrong tanru construct (wherein a given meaning was intended but is not reflected in the {veljvo}). See also: {srejvo}.

rows.d: $x_1=p_1=xl_1$ is a bad/poor performing person for task $x_2=xl_2$ by standard $x_3=xl_3$
rows.n: be careful not to confuse bad/poor performance ({xlali}) with bad/malicious motivations ({palci})

rows.d: $x_1$ and $x_2$ are the same color $x_3$
$j_1$ is cynical/suspicious about the motives of $m_3$ with regard to action/event $m_2=j_3$.
$x_1$ is colorless to observer $x_2$
$x_1$ is death/the idea of death according to $x_2$
rows.n: Death as a noun that is neither a process/state of being dead (respectively: {puvzilmro}, {sazyzilmro}) nor deathness in the sense of the quality of being dead ({kamymro}) nor of the quality of death ({kamyzilmro}). This is the idea unto itself treated as a universal. See also: {sizyzilpalci}, {sizyzilji'e}, {sizyzilji'efri}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a paradoxical problem in which the key to solution can only be obtained by overcoming/solving the problem first
$x_1$ is the concept/idea of lujvo-equivalence, as held by $x_2$
rows.n: See {si'o}, {jvomi'u}, {sidbo}. Essentially to be used to talk about the concept of {jvomi'u} as a feature of Lojban, and to discuss its advantages and disadvantages.

rows.d: $p_1$ is a Syrian pear (Pyrus syriaca) [fruit] of variety $p_2$.
$x_1$ is an eavesdropping device
$t_1=s_1$ is underwear worn/intended to be worn on/by $t_2$ serving purpose $t_3$
$c_1$ is capitalism as practiced by $p_1=s_2$
$x_1=k_1=s_1$ is a private journal/diary with content $x_2=k_2$ written by $x_3=k_3=s_2$.
x1=m1 is better/[less bad] than $m_2$ for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$, by amount $m_4$.
$x_1=m_1$ is worse than $m_2$ for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$, by amount $m_3$.

$x_1$ (possibly indirectly) cites $x_2$, via intermediate citation path $x_3$ (ordered list; ce'o), for information/statement $x_4$, such that said $x_2$ is the ultimate source (along path $x_3$) for said information/statement $x_4$.
rows.n: This word is equivalent to "{sity'utka}" but with the additional requirement that $x_2$ is the final 'link' in the citation chain described by $x_3$ (with $x_1$ and $x_2$ appended to their respective sides). This word is a {brapagjvo} with {zevla} ".{utkaro}".
rows.g: ultimate source of citation;ultimate source of information

rows.d: $x_1 = sitna_1 = .utka_1$  cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to a source, which itself/who themself cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to a source, which itself/who themself in turn cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source, ..., which itself/who themself cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source $x_2 = sitna_2 = .utka_2$, via intermediate path-connecting steps $x_3 = .utka_3$ (ordered list; ce'o), all for the same information/statement $x_4 = sitna_3$ (du'u).
rows.n: The list formed by appending $x_1$ and $x_2$ to the respective ends of $x_3$ is a chain of citations, all for the same piece of information or statement, such that each entry in the list in a direct source for the entry immediately prior to it and an indirect source for all entries prior to that one; $x_2$ may not be the ultimate source for the information, but the information can be tracked back to at least $x_2$ along the path formed. This word is a {brapagjvo} with {zevla} ".{utka}"; it is slightly malformed in that "{sitna}" does not constitute a binary relationship, which is required by ".utka".
rows.g: chain of citations;source of source of ... source of citation

rows.d: $c_1=s_1$ cites/quotes $c_2=s_3$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ from source $_s2$.
$x_1$ is true
$t_1=xl_1$ is malware (malicious software) on computer(s) including $s_1$, which is/does bad for/harms $xl_2$ according to standard $xl_3$.
$x_1$ is a bad/poorly-made lujvo with issue $x_2$, bad according to $x_3$ and by standard $x_4$
rows.n: The badness need not be an error per se; it may merely be some feature (x2) that is not desirable or relatively preferable.  For example, perhaps the terbri structure is not predictable/regular/algorithmic, or the lujvo is very long, or the lujvo is not the highest-scoring lujvo (for some fixed tanru construct) according to an algorithm/standard. See also: {srejvo}.

rows.d: $s_1=p_1$ finds $s_2=p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$j_1$ is pessimistic about $j_3$.

$x1$ (collection/system of objects, generally relative chaos) is/are in alignment/linear arrangement/generalized geometric syzygy/eclipsing configuration/linear set-up, the organization/pattern/result $x2$ of which is according to rule $x3$
$f_1=xl_1$ is unlucky/unfortunate for $f_2=xl_2$ by standerd $xl_3$.
$x_1$ is is a quantity of/made from/consists of fur of animal/species/source $x_2$.
$x_1$ suffers from $x_2$ (event, process, object).
$j_1=s_1$ is a straight angle (=180° or π radians) [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $j_2$ subtended by lateral [segment] $j_3$.
$x1$  (agent) aligns/arranges linearly objects $x2$ into organized arrangement $x3$ by rules $x4$
rows.n: x3 and x4 are constrained by the linearity of the arrangement, but are not uniquely determined by this property: further specification is needed. Not to be used for happenstance or nonagentive meanest/causes for alignment (such as with syzygy).

rows.d: $x1=s1=v1$ snores
$x_1=l_1=r_1=s_1$ experiences sleep paralysis including $x_2=l_2$ (event/experience)
rows.n: I.e. becoming aware of muscle atonia (i.e. unability to move, speak or react) of falling asleep (hypnagogic) or awakening (hypnopompic). Often includes terrifying hallucinations (e.g. "night mare"). Cf. {narslutroka'e}, {sajysne}.

rows.d: $x1=g1$ is a blanket
$d_1=s_1$ is drowsy/sleepy.
$x_1= b_1$ falls asleep under conditions $x_2 = b_3$.
$x1=s1=n1$ is sleepy for reason $x2=n3$
$x_1$ is a sleeping clothing; $x_1$ are pyjamas/pajamas
$t_1=s_1$ is sleepy; $t_1=s_1$ needs/wants sleep.
$x_1$ is a dormouse of species $x_2$.
$sa_2$ is a lullaby sung by $sa_1$ to $sa_3=si_1$.
$g_1=s_1$ snores.
$sa_1$ sings lullaby $sa_2$ to $sa_3=si_1$.
$d_1$ is spiteful/malevolent/malicious/mean to/towards $x_2$.
$x_1=k_1$ is a bedroom with sleep $x_2=s_1$ in structure $x_3=k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_4=k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_1$ = $sa_1$ = $sd_1$ sings lullaby song $x_2$ = $sa_2$ to audience $x_3$ = $sa_3$ = $sd_2$ = $sp_1$ in order to help $x_3$ fall or remain asleep
$xl_1=c_1$ is bad food/junk food (in one sense) for $xl_2=c_2$, bad by standard $xl_3$.
rows.n: The word “bad” is subjective here. The food can be “bad” for $xl_2=c_2$’s health, it can taste bad, etc. The “standard” place can be used for disambiguation.

rows.d: $n_1$ is the Christmas celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$.
$d_1$ is Christmas Day at location $d_3$ in calendar $d_4$.
$n_1$ is Christmas Eve of Christmas Day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$x_1$ is an eel of species $x_2$.
$x_1=b_1=m_1$ is a cathedral [Christian church which contains the seat of a bishop] serving diocese $m_2$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is not true
$x_1$ (set) agree with each other that $x_2$ (proposition) is true about matter $x_3$
$x_1$ rubs $x_2$ together.
$x_1$ is the sum of all of $x_2$ added together
$x_1$ interacts with $x_2$ in manner $x_3$
$x_1=n_2$ is an agreement/contract/treaty between $x_2=n_1=n_3$
$x_1$ is a Christmas of Christset $x_2$ containing Christmember $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ are friends [of each other].
$x_1$ make up/peace with each other under condition $x_2$.
$x_1$ and $x_2$ entail each other.
$x_1=m_1=xr_1$ is a Christian (Catholic/Protestant/Anglican/etc.) church at location/serving area $x_2=m_3$
rows.n: Doesn't distinguish the type of Christianity. cf. {xriso} and {malsi}

rows.d: $x_1$ compares $x_2$ (set/plurality) in property $x_3$ (ka), determining $x_4$ (du'u/state)
rows.n: {simxu} + {karbi}. karbi$_2$ and karbi$_3$ are combined into simkarbi$_2$.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ fight [each other] over issue $x_{2}$ (abstract).
$x_1$ (plural) become mutual in property $x_2$ (ka).
$x_1$ interchanges $x_2$ and $x_3$ in circumstance $x_4$.
$x_1$ trades places with $x_2$ in circumstance $x_3$.
rows.n: See also {simxu}, {basti}. Similar in meaning to {basysi'u}, but keeps {basti}'s place structure.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tool-whistle [v].
$x_1$ is secret/hidden from $x_2$ by method $x_3$.
rows.n: A more general form of {mipri}. {mipri} is equivalent to gasnu pa nu co'a zilmipri.

rows.d: $n_1$ is Easter celebrated by $s_1$ with activities $s_3$
$x_1$ (plurality) interacts in manner $x_2$
$x_1$ is a silkmoth/silkworm [probably Bombyx] of species/breed/type $x_2$
rows.n: No implication is made about its present life stage; for specific/scientific usage, use {bombiksia}; for the larval/caterpillar/worm form, use {sikykemciftoldi}; for the moth/mature/adult form, use {sikma'ubortoldi}; for the cocoon, use {siktodlanka} or {todbi'olanka}. Since many moths have silken cocoons, in order to reference a member specifically of genus Bombyx, use {bombiksia}.

rows.d: $z_1$ is a stable for horse/equine/[colt/mare/stallion/pony] $z_2=x_1$ of species/breed $x_2$
$p_1=s_3$ ski-jumps to $p_2$ from $p_3$ reaching height $p_4$ propelled by/using ski $p_5=s_1$.
$p_1$ is seigniorage earned by $p_2=z_1$ in making coin $z_2=s_1$
$s_1=c_1$ is a medal for $c_2$ given for atypical $c_3$ (event/property) by $c_4$.
rows.n: As in {cnemu}, a positive/negative connotation is not implied. See also: {ve}.

rows.d: $j_1=s_1$ is a medaillion (decorative coin) which decorates $j_2$.
rows.n: Note the focus is on the decorative aspect. For “medal” in the sense of “award”, see {si'irvelne'u}.

rows.d: $r_1$ is horse meat from species/breed $r_2=xi_2$.
$p_1$ is a piece of rolling paper from source $p_2$.
$p_1$ is a / is a quantity of rolling paper from source $p_2$.
$v_1$ is a cigarette/cigar smoker; $v_1$ smokes cigarettes/cigars.
$s_1$ is a horse cavalryman of army $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a noble with nobility standard $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a venusaur [pokemon]
$x_1$ is an ivysaur [pokemon]
$x_1=c_3$ is a predicate relationship.
$p_1=s_1$ is a snow sculpture/statue/[work of art made from snow] representing/depicting/showing $p_2$ made by artist $p_3$.
$t_1$=$s_1$ is a snowboard of material/property $t_2$.
$m_1$ is a snowmobile/snow scooter carrying $m_2$ on snow $m_3$, propelled by force $m_4$.
$c_1=s_1=d_1$ sleets [rain with snow] to $c_2$ from $c_3$.
rows.g: rain and snow;rain with snow;to sleet

rows.d: $d_1$ is an igloo for purpose $d_2$.
$c_1$ is a snowshoe for covering/protecting feet/hooves $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
rows.n: From {snime} {cutci}. Like its English gloss, si'ercutci denotes a shoe built to distribute the wearer's weight to keep her/him from sinking into snow.

rows.d: $c_1=s_1$ snows to $c_2$ from $c_3$.
rows.n: See also: “{snime}” (for the snow as a mass).

rows.d: $s_1=b_1$ is a snowball.
$c_1$ is a snow shovel.
$x_1$ is an odd number (integer not divisible by 2)
$x_1$ is a figurative/metaphorical/non-literal meaning/interpretation of $x_2$ recognized/seen/accepted by $x_3$ .
$m_1$ is a mass of set $m_2$ with an odd number of members $m_3$
$c_1$ neighs.
$k_1$ is a cattle herder/rancher/vaquero/cowboy/cowgirl/buckaroo/paniolo/gaucho/stockman/ringer/gardian herding/tending cattle $k_2=b_1$ on horse(s) $x_1$.
rows.n: Use fu'ivla for more cultural specific usage, like cowboy (={kauvboi}).

rows.d: $s_1$  is a salsa/salsa roja for use with $s_2$, containing ingredient(s) including $s_3$.
rows.n: The sauce is used as a condiment in Mexican and Southwestern (U.S.) cuisines; usually includes cooked tomatoes, chili peppers, onion, garlic, and fresh coriander. Refers to "salsa roja", red sauce, or in English just "salsa".

rows.d: $c_1=k_2$ is a toy shovel for digging $c_2$.
$s_1$ reflects Irish culture/nationality/language in aspect $s_2$.
$z_1=c_1$ is a West African lion [Panthera leo senegalensis] of breed $c_2$.
$x_1$ synthesizes complex concept $x_2$ out of constituent concepts including $x_3$ (jo'u) [less understandable/meaningful in isolation] for purposes of study, using method of synthesis $x_4$.
rows.n: From {sidbo} {mixre} {bo} {gasnu} {lanli} '(idea (mix-make)) examine'. See also {xregau}, {sibyxregau}. Synonyms: {xregaulanli}, {sibyxreborgau}, {sibyxreborgautadni}. Antonyms: {sibytolxreborgau}, {sibytolxreborgaulanli}, {sibytolxreborgautadni}.
rows.g: perform conceptual synthesis;study by synthetic method;synthesise;synthesise concepts;synthesize;synthesize concepts

rows.d: $x_1$ analyzes complex concept $x_2$, finding it to consist of simpler concepts including $x_3$ (jo'u), using method of analysis $x_4$.
rows.n: From {sidbo} {to'e} {mixre} {bo} {gasnu} {lanli} '(idea (non-(mix-make))) analyze'. See also {tolxre}, {tolxregau}. Synonyms: {sibytolxreborgau}, {sibytolxreborgautadni}. Antonyms: {sibyxreborgaulanli}, {sibyxreborgau}, {sibyxreborgautadni}.
rows.g: analyse;analyse a concept;analyse an idea;analyze;analyze a concept;analyze an idea;break down a complex concept;break down an idea;conceptual analysis;do analysis;perform conceptual analysis

rows.d: $x_1$ metaphorically translates/transfers/extends/applies concept $x_2$ to new context $x_3$ from prior context $x_4$; $x_1$ uses concept $x_2$ in new way $x_3$, derived from prior way $x_4$.
rows.n: $x_4$ need not be the original or 'literal' context. {fanva} 'translate' is used here metaphorically, a result of the very process that sibypevyfanva describes: the concept of translation was itself brought into the domain of concepts from the domain of words. sibypevyfanva is somewhat like {metfo} 'use (a {bridi} expression) metaphorically', but used with concepts rather than words. Examples of conceptual 'translation' that could be described with sibypevyfanva are the extension of 'utility' to microeconomics from ethics and the extension of 'law' to the natural world from human legal systems (as reflected in the double meaning of the English word 'law'). Probably synonymous with {sibypevyfu'i}. Some may prefer the sound of the allomorphic form {si'orpevyfanva}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (agent) thinks idea $x_2$ (si'o abstract) about subject $x_3$

rows.n: Counting should (ideally) be perfect, so accuracy is identically and mathematically equal to "1"; the scale sets the "counting [off] by units" and most countable things are counted from "0" (meaning nothing/no instances of the item in question) with each additional occurrence of the (quantized) item being represented by an addition "1". See: {kamre}, {kacmre}.

Use $x_3$ in order to specify whether back-compatibility is grounds to remove/exclude such a conflict; for example, if a single word has two definitions such that they are exactly the same except for the presence of extra sumti slots in exactly one of them (such that these slots follow all of those which they share), then the definitions are technically different (thus leading to a conflict by some standards) but can be reconciled/rectified (thereby eliminating conflict by other standards).

rows.n: This word is a {brapagjvo}. "Give/pay" and "gift/payment" is in the sense of "{cple'ijdu}". See also: ".{utka}", "{setese}". This models the transmission chain of payment in economics (give a worker money, which they use in order to purchase something from someone, who in turn purchases something from someone else, etc.), 'pay it forward' chains in Starbucks lines, regifting or exchange process in multi-step/competitive gift exchanges, etc.

$x_1$ is infected/contaminated by something which was infected/contaminated by something which was infected/contaminated by ... which was infected/contaminated by $x_2$, regarding/pertaining to contagion $x_3$ and via means of transmission $x_4$, through intermediary nodes $x_5$ (ce'o list).
rows.n: This word is a {brapagjvo} of "{se}l{prejumydu'a}" and ".{utka}"; each sumti slot should be interpreted as in those words - for example, "contagion" is used broadly, as in the definition of "prejumydu'a". If we temporarily constrain $x_3$ to a biological disease, then in one sense of the word, $x_2$ (an upstream, although perhaps not ultimate, source) is an epidemiological/'viral' vector of contagion $x_3$; in another sense of the word, $x_5$ (the transmission pathway) is so. See also: "{prejumydu'a'y'utka}". Technically, because "prejumydu'a" is not a binary predicate, it maybe should be avoided as a modifier of ".utka".

$x_1$ is an ordered series of podcast episodes/podcast serial, ordered by conparison rule $x_2$ (contextless default: production order or intended listening order, or reverse of these), and being entirely composed of all of the individual episodes belonging to set $x_3$.
rows.n: Technically, any sequence of any podcast episodes is such a thing. Moreover, some podcasts are just a collection of episodes which have no intended listening order (if old episodes are meant to be listened to at all). However, this word is meant to encompass only canonical serial productions of closely related episodes in a certain listening order. Thus, a playlist on shuffle breaks the spirit/intent of this term but not its technical definition; every episode in a certian program, though, satisfies the intention (especially if $x_2$ is a reasonable listening order thereof) - although complications arise if there is no reasonable listening order to be endowed upon the set of episodes. This word uses a rafsi of an experimental gismu: {kicra}.

Note that $x_1$ is not textual, even though Lojbanists informally tend to call a word or phrase "the selbri" of an utterance. For this usage see {selbrisni}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (partially) eats itself/performs autophagy.
rows.n: This word is broad: It encompasses the actual act of biting into one's own body, removing a segment therefrom, and swallowing it; but it can also include usage of fat stores, dystrophy of muscles, etc. due to starvation, even if no biting occurs. Thus, it is technically happening (at least according to wide definition) much of the time, even if unnoticeably so. It is always a form of {mityjutcti}.

rows.n: The username (c3) should be a quoted string. Cf. {gasnu}, {catni}, {skami}, {sampli}, {japyvla}

rows.d: $k_1$ is 1024 ($2^{10}$) of $k_2$ in dimension/aspect $k_3$ (default is units).
$k_1$ plays with computer/gaming system/gaming console $s_1$.
rows.n: See also: video game (={samyzilkei}), playing with video game (={samyzilkeikei}).

rows.d: $k1$ is an amount of computer elementary particles/smallest measurable increments of computer property/activity $k2$; k1 is a bit(s)
$c_1$ is characterized by computer properties; $c_1$ is digital.
$j_1$ is an adress of / are co-ordinates of computer system / computerized thing $j_2=s_1$ in system $j_3$; computerized thing has purpose $s_2$.
rows.n: Normally, s2 might be dropped, but it's very useful to be able to point out if this is a {samymri} address or a {ueb} address.  Made from {skami} + {judri}.

rows.d: $g_1$ (agent) connects computer $j=1=s_1$ to computer $j_2=s_1$ via medium $j_3$.
rows.n: I.e. Network connection. $x_4$ could be, for example, a cable or network. Cf. {samjo'e}.

rows.d: Computer $j=1=s_1$ is connected to computer $j_2=s_1$ via medium $j_3$.
rows.n: I.e. Network connection. $x_3$ could be, for example, a cable or network.

rows.d: $x_1$ becomes incapable of writing characters $x_2$ of alphabet/writing system $x_3$, which is reflects chinese culture/languge/etc. in aspect $x_4$ and which represent $x_5$, on writing surface/medium $x_6$ with writing implement $x_7$ under conditions of being incapable $x_8$ under conditions of becoming incapable $x_9$, as a result of $x_1$ making excessive use of $x_{10}$ which is a computer for purpose $x_{11}$ or $x_{12}$ which is a phone connected to network $x_{13}$, used for purpose $x_{14}$, excessive by amount $x_{15}$.
rows.n: The two "under conditions" places arise from the incorporation of both {kakne} and {binxo}. They are not to be confused. Ilmen inspired the creation of this lujvo.
rows.g: someone who becomes incapable of writing chinese characters as a result of extensive use of phones or computers

rows.d: $g_1$ is $2^{80}$ of $g_2$ in dimension/aspect $g_3$ (default is units).
$g_1$ is $2^{30}$ of $g_2$ in dimension/aspect $g_3$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is a smartphone attached to system/network $x_2$
$f_1=s_1$ crashes while doing $f_2$ (state / event)
$x_1$ clicks/selects $x_2$.
rows.n: Does not specify the type of device used to select $x_2$. See {kli'iki} and others.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a Saturday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$r_1$ is a kernel of operating system $j_1$ on computer $j_2=s_1$
$x_1=s_1$ is a port/conversion to operating system/architecture $x_2=g_2=j_1$ from operating system/architecture $x_3=g_3=j_1$, ported by $x_4=g_1$
$x_1=j_1$ is an operating system for computer $x_2=j_2=s_1$.
$c_1$ is an e-book containing work $c_2$ by author $c_3$ for audience $c_4$ stored in computer $s_1=c_5$.
$c_1$ enters textual data $c_2$ into computer $c_3=s_2$ by means $c_4$.
rows.n: x4 can be a keyboard, pointing devices, or speech recognition. Cf. {ciska}, {skami}, {batkyci'a}.

rows.d: $t_1$ is a debugger.
$si_1$ debugs [searches for] bug/defect $c_1=si_2$ (property) in computer system or computer program $c_2=si_3=sk_1$.
$x_1$ (property (“ka”)) is a bug/defect in computer program or computer system $x_2$ causing $x_3$.
$c_1$ is a piece of computer hardware for function $c_2$ controlled/used by computer $c_3=s_1$.
$b_1$ is a computer language used by $b_2$ on computer $s_1$ for purpose $s_2$ (NU abstraction).
$x_1=v_1$ is an airplane/aircraft [flying vehicle] for carrying passengers/cargo $x_2=v_2$, propelled by slides/slips/glides on $x_3=s_2$
$san_1$ is a dressing for use with salad $s_2$, containing ingredient(s) including $s_3$.
$p_1$ is the sixth closest planet (default is Saturn if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$x_1$ (surface) is slippery
$p_1$ is a bachelor's degree or equivalent education diploma entitling $p_2$ to entitlement/privilege $p_3$ (event/state) from school/institute/academy $c_1$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$.
rows.n: Sixth level of International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED).

rows.d: $j_1$ has the rank of Brigadier General/Brigadier/Rear Admiral/Commodore  (equivalent of NATO OF-6) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
rows.n: Cf. {xa}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {zelmoija'a}, {mumymoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.
rows.g: Air Commodore;Brigadier;Brigadier General;Commodore;Rear Admiral - Lowe Half

rows.d: $x_1$ is June/the sixth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is June/the sixth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the left mouse button of computer mouse $x_2$.
$s_1=c_1$ is a sled/sledge/sleigh/toboggan for carrying $c_2$, propelled by $c_3$, sliding on $s_2$.
$v_1=s_1$ inhales $v_2=s_2$.
$g_1=s_1=c_1$ is a vacuum cleaner for cleaning $g_2=j_1$ (object/area)/removing dust/containment/dirt $s_2=j_2$ controlled/[triggered] by cleaner x3 (agent).
$x_1$ is a Saturday of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1=b_1$ is a vacuum/cryogenic flask for keeping $x_2=b_2$ hot/cold, made of material $x_3=b_3$ with lid $x_4=b_4$, insulated by low pressure medium $x_5=sa_2=se_3$
rows.g: cryogenic dewar;cryogenic storage dewar;Dewar bottle;Dewar flask;Thermos;vacuum flask

rows.d: $san_1$ is an implosive consonant with place of articulation $x_2$ and phonation $x_3$.
rows.n: cf. {zunsna}. Conventionally, when used with descriptives, comes after the descriptives, e.g. "{voksli} {denrixtolku'o} saksna" means "voiced alveolar implosive"

rows.d: $xa_1=z_1$ is better than $z_2$ for $xa_2$ by standard $xa_3$, by amount $z_4$.
rows.n: Cf. {xamgu}, {zmadu}, {xagmau}, {xagrai}. The {xagmau} form is far more frequently used.

rows.d: $c_1$ consumes $c_2=s_2$ by means of suction; $c_1$ sucks or slurps food/beverage $c_2=s_2$.
$l_1=s_1$ sucks (pulls) $l_2$ at locus $l_3$
rows.n: l3 is part of l2, such as a nipple or the upper surface of an airfoil

rows.d: $c_1$ sucks (gets by sucking) $c_2=s_2$ from $c_3=s_3$
rows.n: If c1 is an animal, s1 is usually in its mouth or nose, and pumping may be involved, as in mosquitoes. See {pambe}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a true bug of species $x_2$ (order Hemiptera),
rows.n: From {sakci} 'suction' + {cinki} 'insect', as Hemiptera are characterized by sucking mouthparts; see {sakcti}. Synonymous with {miptera}. See also {civla}, {sfani}.

rows.d: $x_1=m_1$ (object/event) is excellent/very good/beneficial for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$g_1$ vacuum-cleans $j_1$ (area/object)/removing dust/dirt $j_2$ with vacuum  cleaner $c_1$.
$x_1$ lucid dreams about/that $x_2$ (fact/idea/event/state); $x_2$ is a lucid dream of  $x_1$
$x_1$ (du'u) is subjective/pertaining to subjects (things that are 'aware'); $x_1$ (du'u) depends on subject $x_2$'s perception
$x_1$=$g_1$ alerts $x_2$=$s_1$ to/about/concerning $x_3$=$s_2$; $x_3$ is brought to the attention of/is recognized/realized by $x_2$ by/with the help of/due to agent $x_1$
rows.g: alert to;bring to the attention of;notify

rows.d: $s_1=b_1$ becomes conscious of / aware of / realizes $s_2$ (object/abstract) under conditions $b_3$.
$p_1$ is an upright piano.
$f_1=s_2$ is the dessert of meal $f_2=s_1$
$x_1=b_1$ is a napkin of type/material $x_2=b_2$

$x_1$ is a housemate of/lives together with $x_2$ in habitat/home $x_3$
$j_1$ is the home address of $xa_1=j_1$ with address system $j_3$.
$x_1$ are the lyrics for the song/music $x_2$
$d_1=s_2=t_3$ is a musical/operetta about $d_2$ composed/written by $d_3$ for audience $d_4=s_3=t_2$ with actors $d_5=s_1=t_1$.
$j_1$ is a cricket of species $j_2$.
$d_1=s_2$ is an opera about $d_2$ [plot/theme/subject] by composer $d_3$ for audience $d_4=s_3$ with singers $d_5$.
$b_1=xa_1$ settles in $xa_2$
$x_1$ migrates/moves/travels to new habitat $x_2$ from old habitat $x_3$ via route $x_4$ by means of transport $x_5$
rows.n: Also immigrate, emigrate; but $x_2$ and $x_3$ are not necessarily in different countries.

rows.d: $x_1$ moves (changes in residence) to $x_2$ from $x_3$

$t_1$ is a matchbox made of material $t_3$.
$x_1$ is phosphorus.
$x_1$ is a projectile propelled by $x_2$
$s_1$ is a blade/expanse of seagrass (from families Posidoniaceae, Zosteraceae, Hydrocharitaceae, or Cymodoceaceae) of species/strain $s_2$.
$s_1$ is the oceanography/marine science of planet $x_2$.
$g_1=s_1$ is a choir singing $s_2$ to audience $s_3$.
$j_1$ is a crab/lobster/crayfish/shrimp/krill/[marine crustacean] of species $j_2$.
$j_1$ is a sea mine with explosive material/principle $j_2$.
$d_1$ is a torpedo launched by $d_2$.
$z_1=p_1$ blesses / gives spiritual favour to plan / action $z_2$.
$x_1$ spiritually/demonically/paranormally possesses the body of $x_2$
rows.n: x1 is a spirit or other supernatural entity, but may not necessarily be evil.

rows.d: $p_1=s_1$ is the soul / spiritual self of $s_2$.
$c_1$ is a sea worm of species $c_2$.
$t_1$ is a fruit tart filled with fruit $g_2$.
$x_1$ is a fruit fly of species/type $x_2$
rows.n: May refer to Tephritidae and/or Drosophilidae. See {grute}, {sfani}.

rows.d: $s_1$ (mass) is a quantity of fruit salad [food] with ingredients/components including $r_1=s_2$ (mostly fruits).
$p_1$ is an orchard of fruit $g_1$ of species $g_2$.
$j_1$ is a quantity of marmalade made from fruit $g_1$ of species $g_2$.
$p_1$ is a jam/jelly/confiture/marmalade made from fruit $g_2$ of species $g_2$.
$x_1=m_1$ counteracts sweat odor (deodorant/antiperspirant) due to property $x_2=z_3$ (ka), with composition including $x_3=m_2$ in shape/form $x_4=m_3$
rows.n: Deodorants hinder body odor (from bacterial breakdown of sweat) in some way (masking/destruction); antiperspirants, a subgroup, reduces actual perspiration.

rows.d: $x1=g1=m1$ is ripe in quality $x2=m2$
$x1=c1$ is a husk of $x2=g1=c2$ of species $x3=g2$ composed of $x4=c3$
$x_1$ is the abstract color gray
rows.n: The gismu {grusi} refers to objects which are gray, but not the color gray itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

rows.d: $c_1$ is graysexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ is a grey oak (Quercus grisea) of species/strain $x_2$.
$c_1=x_3$ is a/the sweat/sudoriparous/sudoriferous gland  [body-part] secreting sweat $x_1=c_2$, of body $c_3=x_2$.
$s_1$ gives financial support/donations to $s_2$ to prevent $s_3$ in quantity $r_1$ in currency $r_3$.
$x_1$ is under sea $x_2$ in reference frame $x_3$.
$x_1$ is not there, missing
$x_1$ is a dialect of language $x_2$
$x_1$ is a language with dialects $x_2$ (full set)
rows.n: A narrower term than {bangu}, doesn't denote dialects. See also {bankle}

rows.d: $x_1$ (predicate) is true when applied to argument list $x_2$ (sequence)
rows.n: Synonymous to {brije'u}. The x1 slot can be filled with a property/relation (ka) whose number of free slots match the length of the sequence x2. It can also be filled with a bridi abstraction (du'u) —nullary predicate—, in which case the x2 should be the empty set or possibly zi'o. See also {bridi}.

rows.d: $p_1$ is a dildo/phallic object.
$x_1$ is an artificial/man-made intelligence/consciousness/mind of/in/inhabiting body $x_2$
$k_1$ is a beach/coast of sea $xa_1=k_2$ on landmass $k_3$.
$l_1=r_1$ is an (artificial) pool at site/within land mass $l_2$.
rows.n: Swimming pool (=limna runla'u), bathing pool (=se jinru runla'u).

rows.d: $r_1=k_1$ is a wig/toupee/mirkin worn by $k_2$  on body location $k_3$.
rows.n: Cf. {rutni}, {kerfa}, {zbikre}, {gaskre}, {krebasti}. r2 dropped for lack of use in this context.

rows.d: $j_1$ is a well of fluid $j_2$ dug/drilled at location $j_3$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of technetium (Tc).
$r_1=b_1$ is an artificial/constructed language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
rows.n: Artificial languages do not necessarily have speakers, cf. {bangu}.

rows.d: $g_1$ causes $r_1$ to melt at temperature $r_2$ and pressure $r_3$; $x_1$ melts object $x_2$.
$x_1$ fails to do $x_2$ because it, or a part of it, melts; $x_1$ (light bulb/fuse) burns out
$x_1=s_1=xr_2$ is an angiosperm/magnoliophyta/flowering plant of species $x_2=s_2$ with flower/blossom/bloom $x_3=xr_1$
$x_1$ is an umbellifer (Apiaceae) of genus/species $x_2$.
$p_1=r_1$ is a petal/part of the corolla of flowering plant/angiosperm $p_2=x_1$.
$p_1$ is a flower garden with flowers $g_1$ of species $g_2$.
$p_1$ is a petal on plant $p_2=x_2$.
$x_1$ is a wreath of flowers of type/arrangement  $x_2$
$p_1=c_1$ is a sepal/part of the calyx of flowering plant/angiosperm $p_2=x_1$.
$x_1$ is a bee
rows.n: A member of taxon Anthophila. See {bifce}, {melmybifce}.

rows.d: $x1=b1$ is a bouquet/[bundle of flowers] of species $x2=xr2$, held together by $x3=b3$
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of ruthenium (Ru).
$r_1=g_1$ is Russia
$r_1=b_1$ is the Russian language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$ci_1$ is a shellfish edible for $ci_2$.
rows.n: This is for shellfish that act as food. Cf. {xaskemcakcurnu}, {cakcurnu}, {curnu}.

rows.d: $t_1=r_1$ is coarse clothing/sackcloth.
$cu_1$ is a shellfish of species $cu_2$.
rows.n: This is for aquatic {cakcurnu}. Implication of food is not given. Cf. {xaskemcakydja}, {cakcurnu}, {curnu}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is rough surface of object $x_2$
$x_1=t_1=s_1$ acts like/pretends to be fictional/imaginary character $x_2=t_2=s_2=xa_1=p_1$ imaginary to $x_3=xa_2$, in property/way $x_4=s_3$ under conditions $x_5=t_3$.
$x1=z1$ processes $x2=pr2$ by process $x3=pr1$ for purpose/results $x4=z3=pr3$, passing through steps/stages $x5=pr4$
$c_1$ is a processor/processing unit for purpose $c_2$.
rows.n: Refers to any type of processing units on a computer. Defaults to CPU. For GPU, use {xrarucyca'a}.

rows.d: $xa_1=p_1$ is a character/role/imaginary person created by $xa_2$.
$x_1$ is an imaginary friend of $x_2$.
rows.n: From {xanri} {pendo}. Both $x_1$ and $x_2$ are the same as their corresponding places in both gismu of the veljvo; this is a perfect symmetrical lujvo. See also {cfika}, {senva}, {sucta}, {xa'i}.

rows.d: $p_1 = x_2$ imagines / visualizes imaginary subject / concept $p_2 = x_1$.
rows.n: Not limited to visual imagination.  Made from {xanri} + {pensi}; technically should be selxarpei, but I can't see "xanri pensi" having any other meaning.

rows.d: $x_1$ is transferred/sent/transmitted to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via $x_4$.
rows.n: zi'o erases benji1. benji = gau zilbe'i

rows.d: $x_1$ (quote) is the non-categorizer and non-hyphen remainder of zi'evla/fu'ivla $x_2$ (quote), with properties/form $x_3$ in language [of zi'evla] $x_4$
rows.n: Quotation may be improper. This is the part of the zi'evla that carries the specific meaning of the word; in stage-4 fu'ivla, the entirety of the word is this remainder; the categorizer rafsi and hyphen letter(s) are not included. See also: {zifyvlaklerafsi}

rows.d: $x_1$ (quote) is a zi'evla/fu'ivla categorizer particle/morpheme/unit with meaning/indicating category $x_2$, having properties $x_3$, and that is appended in zi'evla (full word) $x_4$, in language $x_5$
rows.n: Applies to any categorizer particle/word/morpheme/lexeme/string/unit; does not necessarily have to be a single jborafsi (even in Lojban zi'evla). Does not include the hyphen letter, nor the rest of the word (including any letter prefixed thereto if the rest of the word would otherwise start with a vowel). Quote the empty string (lu li'u) if the explicit categorizer is absent; in general, the quote will likely be improper in Lojban. See also: {zifyvlavelvi'u}, {ra'oi}, {zi'evla}, {fu'ivla}

rows.d: $x_1$ is $x_2$ coulombs [default is 1] by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a hackberry/bird cherry of variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a generation [contemporary offspring] of $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a mouse cursor (graphical element) of user interface $x_2$.
rows.n: Specifically refers to the graphical element, not the physical tool. From {xance} + {uidje}. See {samxa'e}, {pevysmacu}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a Buddha's hand (Citrus medica var. sarcodactylis) of type $x_2$
$z_1=x_2$ gives applause to plan/action $z_2$ (object/event).
$r_1=x_1$ is an European ass [Equus hydruntinus] of subspecies/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a rodent-like mammal of type/species/taxon/breed $x_2$, rodent-like in property $x_3$ (ka).
rows.n: {ronte} is an experimental gismu. Probably includes any small, scurrying mammal. All members of mammal order Rodentia are rodent-like, by definition; the use of this word is not restricted to only that set, however.

rows.d: $r_1=t_1$ is Europe
$m_1$ is elephant/mammoth ivory from species/breed $xa_2$.
$x_1$ is is a free modifier (word or construct which can be freely inserted into or deleted from a sentence without making it ungrammatical)
$ru_1=ro_1$ is $ru_2$ euros.
$z_1=ri_2$ is orchestral music (classical music or music written in a classical style) produced/performed by $z_2=ri_1$ (event), with form/rules/in tradition $ri_4$.
$p_1$ is an European pear (Pyrus communis) [fruit] of cultivar/variety $p_2$.
$x_1$ is Eurasia.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of europium [Eu]
$r_1=g_1$ is the European Union with member states $g_2$ (mass)
$j_3=xa_1$ is a wrist of $xa_2$.
$x_1=g_3$ is a flashlight/portable light source for illuminating $g_2$, emitting light form $x_3=g_1$.
$x_1$ (plural) is everything that exists for $x_2$ (person) under metaphysics $x_3$
$x_1$ knows all the rafsi/morphemes of language $x_2$
$c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits a panromantic orientation by standard $c_4$.
$x_1=d_1$ knows everything about $x_2=d_3$ by epistemology $x_3=d_4$; $x_1=d_1$ is omniscient about matter(s) $x_2=d_3$.
$p_1$ loves everyone and everything.
$b_1$ is outdoors; $b_1$ is outside of all buildings.
$x_1$ (property) is common to everything in the domain of discourse
$x_1$ is the same thing as $x_2$.
$x_1$ (nu) [typically] happens everyday
$x_1$ is local train that stops every station of cars/units $x_2$ (mass) for rails/system/railroad $x_3$, propelled by $x_4$.
$x_1$ occurs daily
$x_1$ is inevitable under conditions $x_2$; Any cases under conditions $x_2$ result in $x_1$
$x_1$ is every night
$c_1$ is pansexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
$r_1=k_1$ is a cornerstone of structure $k_2$ of stone type/composition $k_3=r_2$.
$x_1$ is an obelisk.

$x_1$ =$g_1$ (agent) petrifies/turns/'freezes'/fossilizes $x_2$=$b_1$ into rock/fossil/statue $x_3$=$r_1$=$b_2$ (result) of rock composition $x_4$=$r_2$ and at/from location $x_5$=$r_3$ under conditions $x_6$=$b_3$.
rows.n: Useful for Gorgons/Medusa/Basilisks. x2 need not be a victim and need not die (animation may be suspended, for example) nor be permanently petrified. Petrification must be agentive. The process/mechanism of petrification is not specified and may be natural or magical (etc.). See also: {ro'irbi'o}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the petrified/fossilized remains/remnant/trace of (once-)biological entity/organism $x_2$ with rock composition $x_3$ and location $x_4$
rows.n: The remains must have become stone/rock (so, are not "fresh"). The remains need not be a body (part) but must have originated from a biological entity (trace: tracks/footprints, feathers/hair, scat, etc.). See also: {mivyvelvicyvauro'i}

rows.d: $b_1=r_1$ is a stone [loose, single lump made of rock/stone].
$s_1=r_1$ is a pebble/piece of stone of type/composition $r_2=s_2$ from location $r_3$.
$s_1=r_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lithium [Li].
$s_1$=$r_1$ is petrology [science about rock/stone] based on methodology $s_3$.
rows.n: terdi2, terdi3 and saske2 subsumed. See also {derske},{kunske},{rokci}.

rows.d: $s_1$ is a rock face / rock surface of rock / mountain $s_2=r_1$ on side $s_3$ with edges $s_4$.
rows.n: Rock composition and origination dropped.  Made from {rokci} + {sefta}.

rows.d: $re_{1}$ throws/launches/casts/hurls stones $ro_{2}$=$re_{2}$ to/at/in direction $re_{3}$.
$x1$ is a terrain characterized by rock $x2$
$x_1$ is a rocky planet/terrestrial planet/'Earth', revolving around $x_2$ with planetary characteristics (possibly including rock composition) $x_3$ and orbital parameters  $x_4$
$c_3$ is a chalkboard/blackboard/slate where $c_2$ gets written by $c_1$ using chalk $c_4=p_1$.
$p_1$ is a chalk/chalk stick made of material $p_2=r_1$.
rows.n: A small stick of "chalk" used for writing on chalkboards. Typically not made of actual chalk. Cf. {rokpisterci'a}, {ciska}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a grandfather of  $x_2$.

$x_1$ is direct ancestor/mentorial-ancestor of $x_2$ of order $x_3$ (li; nonnegative integer) in graph/network of ancestry (family tree) $x_4$ (defaults to maximal option), where $x_3$ is the smallest possible number which is so constrained; $x_1$ is the $x_3$th-great-grandparent of $x_2$.
rows.n: If $x_3=0$, then $x_1 = x_2$; if $x_3=1$, then $x_1$ is the parent/mentor/rirni $x_2$; if $x_3=2$, then $x_1$ is the grandparent/mentor's mentor/{riryrirni} of $x_2$; if $x_3=n$, then $x_1$ is the ($n-2$)th-great-grand-parent of $x_2$ (id est: great-great-...-great-grandparent, where the number of "great-"s is $n-2$). $x_3$ must be the geodesic path length; in an actual tree-graph family tree, this is the only option; but, in practice, there is usually some closure of the graph (inbreeding/incest) and one specimen may be the ancestor of the subject in multiple different ways; in such cases, the shortest path(s) are the ones which determine $x_3$ and, thus, $x_4$ can be used to subtract out those connections in order to say something like "A is both B's grandparent and B's great-grandparent" (the latter requiring edge-subtraction from the ancestry graph). See also: ".{utka'au}", "{rirni}", ".{abvele}", {riryriryrirni}.

rows.d: $x_1$ raises/is a mentor to someone who raises/is a mentor to someone who raises/is a mentor to [...]  to someone who raises/is a mentor to $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
rows.n: Can be used for 'PhD advisor ancestry'. Usage of mixed standards of raising/mentoring telationship is possible; thus, the parent of the PhD advisor of one's parent is a form of rirny'utka to oneself. This is a broader notion of ancestorhood than is "{ginlazdze}".

rows.n: This group includes the land plants plus various groups of green algae, including stoneworts. The names given to these groups vary considerably as of July 2011. Viridiplantae encompass a group of organisms that possess chlorophyll a and b, have plastids that are bound by only two membranes, are capable of storing starch, and have cellulose in their cell walls.

rows.n: Typically will assume linear time. However, recurring events/holidays/named dates will behave cyclically unless the cycle label (such as Gregorian year label for annual holidays) is used; in these contexts, $x_3$ will multivalued (in terms of acceptable submissions) and could even be negative; for example, a generic Christmas is always $x_3 = 7$ days ahead of the nearest New Year's Day in the Gregorian calendar. See also: "{prulamdei}", ".{utka'au}".

$x_1$ infects a recipient who infects a recipient who infects ... who infects recipient $x_2$ with contagion $x_3$ via means of infection/contamination $x_4$ and through intermediaries $x_5$ (ce'o list).; $x_1$ spreads contagion $x_3$ through a network such that they indirectly infect $x_2$ via a route through finitely-many intermediary nodes $x_5$.
rows.n: This word is a {brapagjvo} of "{prejumydu'a}" and ".{utka}"; each sumti slot should be interpreted as in those words - for example, "contagion" is used broadly, as in the definition of "prejumydu'a". Technically, because "prejumydu'a" is not a binary predicate, it maybe should be avoided as a modifier of ".utka". See also: "{selprejumydu'a'y'utka}".
rows.g: indirectly infect;infect someone who infects someone who infects ...  who infects someone;transitively infect

rows.d: $x_1$ gives/exchanges/spreads contagion $x_2$ to $x_3$ via means $x_4$; $x_1$ infects $x_3$ with $x_2$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is a contagion in the sense of {prejume}$_1$. $x_3$ may be an individual or a population, or even an object which itself cannot be a long-term host of $x_2$. This word is a {brapagjvo} in part from "{prejume}". The infection need not be sustained/successful (from the standpoint of the would-be contagion $x_2$); the infection need not be noticeable or cause adverse effects (use this word in conjunction with "{bilma}" for that) - this is purely about the act of exchanging. Technically, lo prejume cannot really prejumydu'a something else - English conflates "infect" as in "Harry (a person) infected Ron (another person) with the flu" with "infect" as in "the flu infected Ron"/"Ron was infected by the flu" (where the point of origination is not of focus, merely the fact that the flu is spreading throughout Ron's body).
rows.g: exchange contagion;get someone sick;give contagion to;infect;spread contagion;spread virus

One may or may not have the object in one's physical or immediate possession; the concept of what constitutes "having in one's physical possession" is left semantically ambiguous. Permanence of this status or authority over it is not specified. This word uses the experimental rafsi "-pov-" for the word {po'o}.

rows.d: $j_1$ is smegma of $p_2$.

rows.n: Though there has been a great amount of debate in Lojbanistan over the need for a lujvo as such, I thought I would submit it anyway.

rows.n: Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for “{pe'a}”). The word “{cimjvo}” is an example of such a lujvo and synonymous to pevycimjvo.

rows.d: $x_1=c_1$ is "woke" to/aware of $x_2$
rows.n: A translation of the informal American English "woke". Caution: it's extremely {malgli} and may be misconstrued by non-{gliselbau}. x2 can be a societal injustice or some other pressing issues.

rows.d: $x_1=v_1=f_1$ is a stage 4 fu'ivla meaning $x_2=v_2$, based on word $x_3=f_2$ in language $x_4$.
rows.n: 'stage 4 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {cibyfu'ivla} - 'stage 3 fu'ivla'

rows.d: $s_1$ is cognitive science/cognitive psychology, of/about subject matter $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
rows.n: Distinct from neuroscience ({benske}). Encompasses any scientific discipline studying cognition (not necessarily human cognition), and, perhaps, also subfields of philosophy concerned with the nature of reasoning.

rows.n: From {falnu}, {vofli} (f2, f3, v2 subsumed). See also {volfanjacta'o}.

rows.n: The Linnaean binomial Nelumbo lutea (Willd.) is the currently recognized name for this species, which has been classified under the former names Nelumbium luteum and Nelumbo pentapetala, among others.

Related: {pegyuenzi}, {peglfi}, {pegrsto}, {pegrpoi}, {pegnpe}, {pegnaka}, {pegrcu'a}, {pegrke'u}, {pegrsu'o}, {pegrsu'e}

rows.d: $s_2$ is phonetics based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_1$ is a friend of a friend of ... a friend of $x_2$ (experiencer), path-connected by the directed friendship relationship via intermediate nodes (friends) $x_3$ (list; ce'o).
rows.n: No friendship relation is necessarily symmetric. This word is a {brapagjvo} using {zevla} ".{utka}". Slightly shorter than "{pendy'utka}", which is semantically equivalent.
rows.g: friend of a friend;friend of a friend of a friend ...

rows.d: $x_1$ are friends (of each other, distributively)
rows.n: This is the {jvajvo} version of {simpe'o}. cf {pendo} and {simxu}

rows.d: $x_1$ feels friendly/fraternal love [philia] toward $x_2$
$v_1$ is a touchscreen serving function $v_2$.

The feel/texture of $c_1=r_1=p_2$ is hair-raising/sets one's teeth on edge/squicks/gives the willies/heebie-jeebies to $p_1$, who touches it with $p_3$ [a locus on $p_1$ or an instrument] at $p_4$ [a locus on $c_1=r_1=p_2$].
rows.n: The unpleasant feeling induced is the same as that in {tinmosycpina}, but caused by touch rather than hearing.

rows.d: $x_1$ is pleasant to the touch / feels good to touch, to $x_2$
$x_1$ is a text cursor (computer graphical element) of user interface $x_2$
$x_1$ is a vocal sound (vowel, consonant...)
voice $x_1=s_1=v_1$ of individual $x_3=v_2$ oscillates at frequency $x_2=s_2$.
$x_1$ (set) is composed of members which interbreed with one another.
rows.n: This statement does not merely say that they *can* mutually interbreed, but that they *do*. It is uncertain whether it would be acceptable to use this word in reference to a set of cardinality greater than two in binary-sexed sexual species (for example: a set of two women and one man may be said to internally interbreed if the man breeds with each woman, but the women would be incapable of breeding with one another).

rows.d: $x_1$ (individual, mass, or population (set?)) and $x_2$ (individual, mass, or population (set?)) are capable of mutually interbreeding/producing offspring with one another.
rows.n: This word is symmetric under exchange of $x_1$ with $x_2$ (conversion by "se"). $x_1$ need not be able to or actually fulfill the same roles in reproduction as $x_2$ or vice-versa; actual instances of reproduction need not occur/be realized. The standard for what constitutes ability to interbreed (is it just genetics? Do physiological/anatomical features restricting, say, gestation and successful birth matter? Must the populations actually know of one another?) is ambiguous and left unspecified.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a grandchild of $x_2$.
$r_1$ has many children.
$x_1$ miscarries after being pregnant with $x_2$
$b_1=z_1$ is the left arm [body-part] of $b_2=z_2$.
$x1$=$p4$ is the locus/place of (vocal) articulation of sound/vocal product $x2$=$v1$=$c2$ made by instrument/locus/vocalization tool $x3$=$p3$ in individual speaker $x4$=$v2$=$c1$=$p1$
rows.n: x3 will most likely be loci of the surface of the tongue, lips, teeth, interior regions of the cheeks, uvula, epiglottis, glottis, pharynx, roof of the mouth, jaws, etc. (Arguably could apply to regions of crickets legs aand other parts of the body for various organisms/entities, including humans; but it must be "vocal" in a generalized sense).

rows.d: $k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) potfuls in quantity.
