$s_1$ is the single, unambiguous meaning of $s_2$ recognized/accepted by $s_3$; $x_2=s_2$ is unambiguous/explicit according to $x_3=s_3$.

$x1$ is the one(-like) element/multiplicative identity of structure/ring $x2$; often is denoted by  ' $1_R$ ' or  ' $I_R$  ' or by  (when context is obvious)  '1' or 'I', for structure/ring R (given by $x2$).
rows.n: Definition and rules may be specified in the second terbri; this definition does not suppose that the ring is not the 0-ring  (the trivial ring) with the mapping of all multiplications to 0 (in which case, the additive identity is also the multiplicative identity). The usage of "additive" and "multiplicative" in this context are defined by the ring. The n×n identity matrix over a given ring is an example of one such element. See also: {nonsmi}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a zygote / one-cell embryo of parent(s) $x_2$

$x_1$ (si'o / proposed-or-existing cmavo) deserves a monosyllabic cmavo $x_2$, even though language $x_3$ (default Lojban) is running out of cmavo space, because of letteral-manipulation cmavo $x_4$ and other-rarely-used cmavo $x_5$, and it must have that monosyllabic cmavo at time $x_6$ (default: lo ca'abna), [insert expletive $x_7$ (default zo mabla)] it!
$x_1$ is a unicorn.
rows.n: Refers specifically to animals of the unicorn species, not the result of removing a horn from a two-horned animal.

rows.d: $j_2$ is a monopole with end $j_1$.
$c_2$ believes in one god/deity $c_1$ with dominion over $c_3$; $c_2$ is a monotheist.
$p_1=s_1$ is alone, lacking the company of $s_2$.
$x_1$ a single-use tool/implement/implement for doing $x_2$; $x_1$ is designed to be discarded after the first use.
rows.n: From {pa} {pilno} {tutci}. Less ambiguous synonyms: {pavyfautci}, {pavyfauselpli}. Cf. {pavyplikai}/{pavyselplikai} 'be single use', {festerplatci} 'disposable tool', {festerplakai} 'disposable'.

rows.d: $p_1$ is the closest planet (default is Mercury if p2 is the Sun) revolving around $p_2$ (default is the Sun), with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$x_1$ is November/the eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is November/the eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ (sound, text) is a monophthong.
$x_1=v_1=f_1$ is a stage 1 fu'ivla meaning $x_2=v_2$, based on word $x_3=f_2$ in language $x_4$.
rows.n: 'stage 1 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a Lojban quote including text of any language (see example) as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla', {cibyfu'ivla} - 'stage 3 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla'

rows.d: $x_1$ is a single-use/one-time tool/utensil/resource/implement used for doing $x_2$ (and discarded afterward).
rows.n: From {pavyfau} {tutci}. Synonyms: {pavyfauselpli}, {pavyplitci}. See also {festerplatci} 'disposable tool', {festerplakai} 'be disposable'.
rows.g: disposable utensil;one-time tool;one-time utensil;single-use implement;single-use resource;single-use tool;single-use utensil

rows.d: $x_1$ is a one-time event/occurrence; $x_1$ does not happen again.
rows.g: happen only once;not happen again;not reoccur;not repeat;one-time;one-time event;one-time occurrence

rows.d: $c_1$ is monosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: Monosexual means sexual interest in only one sex/gender, so this word does not apply to bisexuals (= {relcinse}). Cf. {fetcinse}, {nakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

rows.d: $pr_1$ is (a) monosexual/non-bisexual.
$x_1$ is a nonce (one-time use) lujvo used by $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$
rows.n: A {noi} clause can be added to x1 if desired.

rows.d: $x_1$ uses $x_2$ once, for purpose $x_3$
$x_1$ happens once in interval $x_2$.
$x_1$ is December/the twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is December/the twelfth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$k_1$ is/are (a) dodecahedron(s)/dodecahedra/regular polyhedron [3-dimensional shape/form] and composed of twelve pentagonal sides $k_3=b_3$.
rows.n: See also dodecahedron (={pavrelbli}), not necessarily regular.

rows.d: $j_1$ has the rank of Field Marshall/General of the Army//Fleet Admiral/Marshall of the Air Force (equivalent of NATO OF-10) in military unit $j_2$.
rows.n: Cf. {pa}, {no}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {sozmoija'a}, {bivmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.
rows.g: Admiral of the Fleet;Field Marshal;Fleet Admiral;General of the Air Force;General of the Army;Marshal of the Indian Air Force;Marshal of the Royal Air Force

rows.d: $x_1$ is October/the tenth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is October/the tenth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$d_1$ is the common logarithm (base 10) of $d_2$.
rows.n: Synonymous to {dekydugri}. See also {te'o zei dugri}, {reldugri}, {dugri}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a dugout for carrying $x_2$

$x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the female-only first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born daughter of the first-born daughter of ... the first-born daughter of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born daughters) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).
rows.n: Not necessarily restricted to only females iff the case can be made of female-filial/thygatric/daughterial relation despite gender; $x_2$ need not be female. Will typically be restricted to biological or adoptive relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean?). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.

rows.d: $x_1$ is any child of the first child of the first child of ... the first child of $x_2$, with intermediate steps $x_3$ (complete ordered list, "ce'o"; should include the relevant parent of $x_1$), where "first" is according to (partial) ordering rule $x_4$ (default: chronological order of birth per successive generation within the given lineage; other restrictions on legitimacy etc. may be specified here as well).
rows.n: The children of $x_2$ are valid candidates for $x_1$ due to trivial contraction of the relation. As an example: if Queen Elizabeth II of the UK/Commonwealth is $x_2$ and chronological order of birth for legitimate children (gender-neutral primogeniture on legitimate descent) is used as $x_4$, then the set of possible $x_1$s includes (and, as of 9 May A.D. 2019, is equal to the set of) all of the children of Elizabeth II, the legitimate children of her son Charles (William, Harry), and all of William's children (George, Charlotte, Louis); notice that the descendants of Elizabeth II not via Charles are excluded, as are any descendants not by William (including Harry's children); the next generation of possible $x_1$s will be (supposing that they come to exist) the children of George (the first-born legitimate son of William first-born legitimate son of Charles first-born legitimate son of Queen Elizabeth II) but not the descendants of William not by George; the fact that all of the intermediate steps are male is mere coincidence; this selbri in this example is a generalization of how the title "prince" is automatically bestowed in this line (excluding by marriage), at present, except for those who are granted princehood by virtue of being the children of the sons of the sovereign. (Technically, in at least some contexts, $x_3$ would have to be deleted or made variable in order to specify all such princes because any given sequence of intermediate steps, even if elliptical, will essentially uniquely specify the parent of $x_1$). See: "{pavmompazy'utka}".

rows.d: $x_1$ is any child of the first child of the first child of ... the first child of $x_2$, where the graph geodesic through the ancestorship-directed family tree from $x_1$ to $x_2$ is of length $(x_3) + 1$ (li; $x_3$ must be a nonnegative integer or positive infinity), and where "first" is according to (partial) ordering rule $x_4$ (default: chronological order of birth per successive generation within the given lineage; other restrictions on legitimacy etc. may be specified here as well).
rows.n: Respects the direction (possibly asymmetry) of the relation so that the graph geodesic distance from A to B may not equal that of from B to A (and either of them may not be defined at all or may be infinite); path-linking is as in ".{utka}". Other properties are as in or analogous to those of "{pavmompazy'utka'ypanzi}". Due to restrictions on $x_3$, $x_1$ and $x_2$ must be mutually distinct. As an example: If Queen Elizabeth II of the UK/Commonwealth is $x_2$ and chronological order of birth for legitimate children (gender-neutral primogeniture on legitimate descent) is used as $x_4$, then the set of possible $x_1$s includes (and, as of 9 May A.D. 2019, is equal to the set of) all of the children of Elizabeth II, the legitimate children of her son Charles (William, Harry), and all of William's children (George, Charlotte, Louis); notice that the descendants of Elizabeth II not via Charles are excluded, as are any descendants not by William (including Harry's children); the next generation of possible $x_1$s will be (supposing that they come to exist) the children of George (the first-born legitimate son of William first-born legitimate son of Charles first-born legitimate son of Queen Elizabeth II) but not the descendants of William not by George; the fact that all of the intermediate steps are male is mere coincidence; this selbri in this example is a generalization of how the title "prince" is automatically bestowed in this line (excluding by marriage), at present, except for those who are granted princehood by virtue of being the children of the sons of the sovereign - in particular, if "{su'e} {re}" is submitted as $x_3$, then the rules match at present (with the aforementioned exception) because the automatic granting of the title halts with the children of William (who possess the longest possible graph geodesics to the queen by this relation).
rows.g: child of primogenitic line of length n

rows.d: $x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the (non-gendered/absolute) first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born offspring of the first-born offspring of ... the first-born offspring of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born offspring) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list), "first" being according to ordering rule $x_4$ (default, as used in this definition: chronological order of birth; restrictions on legitimacy etc. may also be included here).
rows.n: Despite the definition saying "first-born" repeatedly, other orderings may be specified by $x_4$, in which case "firstness" is according to the specified rules (and applies to $x_1$ and the members of $x_3$ (but not necessarily $x_2$) each in turn for their generation and lineage (in other words: each of child will be the 'first' child of the previous member, until but not necessarily including $x_2$, where "firstness" is as defined; importantly, the "firstness" relation will not be compared across generations (it renews with each generation) or across lineages - it is a partial ordering). This word's usage will typically be restricted to biological relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean? Additionally, "{panzi}" is seemingly restrictive in this regard). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.

rows.d: $x_1$ is path-connected to $x_2$ via the male-only first-born progeny/primogeniture relation; $x_1$ is the first-born son of the first-born son of ... the first-born son of $x_2$, connected by a graph-path passing through intermediate relations/steps (successive first-born sons) $x_3$ (ce'o; ordered list).
rows.n: Not necessarily restricted to only males iff the case can be made of male-filial relation despite gender; $x_2$ need not be male. Will typically be restricted to biological or adoptive relations (otherwise, what is the point/what does the word mean?). Append with seltau "{sarcu}" for qualified/conditional primogenture; append with tertau "{cerda}" in order to reference primogeniturial inheritance.

rows.d: $x1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of helium (He; the first noble gas)
$j_1$ has the rank of Lieutenant/1st Lieutenant (equivalent of NATO OF-1) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
rows.n: Cf. {pa}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {relmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

rows.d: $x_1$ is $x_2=d_2$ (default: 1) first days of a set of days (week, month, year) $x_3=m_2$ ordered by rule $x_4=m_3$ and being a day by standard $x_5=d_3$
rows.n: When the set entered is a week, the meaning becomes monday. See {pa}, {moi} and {djedi}.
rows.g: first day;first member of a set of days;monday

rows.d: $c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits a strictly homoromantic orientation by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: This word does not apply to biromantic people and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "homoromantic". Cf. {pavmitcinse}, {pamcinse}.

rows.d: $c_1$ is strictly homosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: This word does not apply to bisexuals and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "homosexual". Cf. {pavycinse}, {mitcinse}, {pavdutcinse}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (number) is the quantity of individual specimens in the domain of discourse that satisfy the property $x_2$
rows.n: Individual counting quantification. For plural quantification, see {suzmeidza}.

rows.d: $m_1$ is singular.
$x_1$ is less than the multiplicative identity; $x_1$ contracts/reduces/scales down something when multiplying it.
rows.n: This is a multiplicative sense of "negative".

rows.d: $x_1$ is greater than the multiplicative identity; $x_1$ expands/dilates/scales up something when multiplying it.
rows.n: This is a multiplicative sense of "positive".

rows.d: $x_1$ is January/the first month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is January/the first month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$t_1$ is a vehicle of units x2 for monorail x3, propelled by x4.
$x_1$ is the only thing that $x_2$; $x_1$ is the sole $x_2$-er; only $x_1$ is $x_2$.
$c_1$ is strictly heterosexual in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: This word does not apply to bisexuals and is the direct Lojban equivalent of English "heterosexual". Cf. {pavycinse}, {dutcinse}, {pavmitcinse}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the reciprocal/multiplicative inverse of $x_2$ .
$x_1$ is a Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$b_1$ is the first Buddha, Siddhartha Gautama.
$x_{1}$ is a P-wave / primary wave in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.
$x_1$ is a step-parent via the father of $x_2$ due to marriage with the latter's father according to law/custom $x_3$, where said fatherhood is not necessarily biological.
rows.n: $x_1$ does not necessarily raise $x_2$ (for such a purpose, append "{rirni}" vel sim. as a tertau). The gender of $x_1$ is not specified. See also: {mamspe}, {rirspe}, {spepa'u}.

rows.d: $p_1$ is a bond issued by $d_1$ held by $d_3$.
$x_1$ is a vocal fold of $x_2$
$x_1=s_1=v_1$=ko'a dreams that they are flying ($x_2=s_2$="lo du'u ko'a vofli" fixed) by means $x_3=v_2$; $x_2$ is a flying dream of $x_1$; $x_1$ has flying dream $x_2$.
$v_1=p_1$ sighs in exasperation responding to $p_2$ (event/state).
$p_1=t_1$ complains verbally to $p_3=t_2$ about $p_2=t_3$ in language $t_4$
$k_1=v_1$ flies to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5=v_2$.
$x_1=p_1$ is Protestant in aspect $x_2$.
$s_1=p_1$ protests/objects to/complains about $s_2=p_2$ with action $s_3=p_4$ to audience $p_3$.
$c_1=p_1$ protests expressing $c_2$ to audience $c_3=p_3$ via medium $c_4$ about $p_2$.
$pa_1=pe_1$ disapprovingly minds/cares $pa_2=pe_2$.
$j_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of potato starch from potatoes $p_1$.
$x_1$ is a penis of $x_2$.
$k_{1}$ comes/goes out/forth towards destination $k_{2}$ from origin $k_{3}$ via route $k_{4}$ using means/vehicle $k_{5}$.
$s_1=p_1$ is a dress/gown (full-length un-legged garment) of material $s_2=p_2$.
$r_1$ is an affix/combining form for zi'evla word $r_2=z_1$, form/properties $r_3$.
rows.n: From {zi'evla}+{rafsi}. {zi'evla} are predicate words of an open class in Lojban, defined by their morphology. Compare {zevlyjvo}, a compound word made of one or more zevlyrafsi. See also {zevla}, {lujvo}, {brapagjvo}, {cmapagjvo}, {fu'ivla}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a zi'evla-based lujvo meaning $x_2$, with arguments $x_3$ from tanru/compound-phrase $x_4$
rows.n: Refers to {lujvo} formed from {zi'evla} via a morphological extension using -(')y(')-  hyphens, e.g. {xanyuidje}, {lacy'inda}. Cf. {zeiljvo}, {zevla}

rows.d: $k_1=c_1$ creeps/crawls to $k_2$ from $k_3$ via $k_4$ using $k_5=c_4$.
$p_1$ jumps up and down on $p_2=p_3$ reaching height $p_4$ propelled by $p_5$
$c_1=p_1$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on barrier/portal $c_2=p_2$ to destination side $p_3$ from origin side $p_4$ using $c_4$ [limbs/tools]
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {cpare}, {pagre}

rows.d: $x_1=m_1=m_2$ hides from $x_2$ by method $x_3$
$k_1$ has volition/is a volitional entity.
$x_1$ make up/peace with each other under condition $x_2$.

$x_1$ is a side of sheet/leaf of paper/page/thin writing surface (card), or is a quantity of text equivalent thereto, of sheet/leaf of 'paper' $x_2$ in document/book/bound mass or sequence of pages $x_3$.
rows.n: In physical books or the like, pieces of paper ($x_2$) are what is touched, flipped, or held, but sides of paper/pages are what are numbered (2 per piece of paper) and what are read. See also: "{papri}".
rows.g: page;page as quantity of text;side of a page

rows.d: $x_1$ considers/decides whether or not to do $x_2$ (ka)
$pi_1$ is a cross section/tomogram, a picture of slice $pa_1$=$pi_2$ of $pa_2$ made by $pi_3$ in medium $pi_4$.
rows.n: {samterpli} pa'oxra = CAT scan. There is another kind of tomogram which may be better termed {tadmijyxra}.

rows.d: $x_1=v_1$ influences the power dynamics of situation $x_2=v_3$ towards end $x_3=v_2$ through means of influence $x_4$.
$tu_1=tr_1=v_1$ is a dictator over/in subjects/territory $tu_2$ under conditions $v_3$.
$x_1$ sniffs $x_2$; $x_1$ acts as to know what is the odor of $x_2$
$x_1$ decides to do $x_2$ (ka)

$x1$=$b2$=$p3$ is a (predicate) equivalence relationship/similarity/parallel with/between/among arguments (sequence(s)/set(s)) $x2$=$b3$=$p1$=$p2$, partitioning (with only empty intersection) set/structure $x3$=$p4$; elements of $x2$ are mutually similar in property $x1$ within structure $x3$; $x3$  is partitioned by $x1$ into equivalence classes (including) $x2$;
rows.n: An equivalence relation is reflective, symmetric, and transitive.  Likewise for the first two terbri of {panra}.  Therefore, order of x2 is unimportant. See also: {panra}, {panrykle}, {terpanryziltolju'i}
rows.g: equivalence class partitioning: the equivalence relation inducing the partitions;equivalence relation: emphasizes the relation over its features/the structure involved

rows.d: $x1$=$k1$ (mass/si'o) is an equivalence class within/is a substructure of  $x2$ (mathematical structure/object/category/set endowed with operations and properties) with defining characteristic/property/for similarity/under equivalence relation $x3$=$p3$, with representative member $x4$=$p1$=$p2$, in geometry/by standard/under paradigm $x5$=$p4$
rows.n: x5 may have some overlap with x2. See also: {panra}, {klesi}, {terpanryziltolju'i}, {panryzilbri}
rows.g: equivalence class;equivalence relation;representative of equivalence class

rows.d: $x_1$ and $x_2$ have or had (not necessarily simultaneously) the same relationship to $x_3$, that relationship being $x_4$, with the relevant difference(s) between $x_1$ and $x_2$ being $x_5$.
rows.n: The (ordered) relationship which exists/existed(/will exist?) between $x_1$ and $x_3$ (in that order) is the same relationship, modulo difference $x_5$, which at some time exists/existed(/will exist?) between $x_2$ and $x_3$ (in that order). For differences in timing (for example: an ex-boyfriend and a current boyfriend of the same person were/are both boyfriends of that person - but not simultaneously; they are temporally-displaced co-boyfriends of that person, in a sense), mention that timing in $x_5$. This word can be used for co-partners in romantic relationships, 'sister wives' (co-spouses) in marriage to some common third individual(s), co-parents of shared children, etc. See also: "{glepanryborki'i}".

rows.d: $v_1$ is an OR gate with input [pins] $v_2$ and output [pins] $v_3$ in circuit/system $v_4$.
at least one of the statements $x_1$ (du'u) and $x_2$ (du'u) is true (logical disjunction)
$z_1=d_1$ is hesitant/is reluctant/hesitates/lingers in employing means/taking action $z_2=d_4$ because of $z_3$, waiting until $d_2$ at state $d_3$
$x_1$ (person/agent) commits a crime $x_2$, punishable to people/culture/judges/jury $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a loofa of variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a sponge of species $x_2$.
$g_1=p_2$ is an incense stick with odor $x_2=p_1$.
$j_1=p_2$ is incense emitting odor $p_1$.
$k_1$ (tool/blade/force) rips/tears/shreds $k_2$ (object) into pieces $k_3$
$x_1=xa_1$ is hungry to talk about $x_2$ using words in language $x_3=v_3$. In other words, $x_1=xa_1$ wishes there existed useful words for $x_2$ in the language $x_3=v_3$.
$c_4$ (text) is a definition of word(s)/phrase/definiendum $c_2=v_1$ with definiens $v_2$ in language $v_3$, as defined by $c_1$.
$x_1$ is odorless to observer $x_2$
$x_1$ love each other; $x_1$ are in love
$x_1$ pets (affectionately strokes) $x_2$ with $x_3$
$l_1$ is a lily of the Nile/African lily (genus Agapanthus) of species/strain $l_2$.
$pr_1$=$pe_1$ is a lover of $pr_2$=$pe_2$.
$p_1&p_2=l_1$ (mass) date via route $l_2$ using means $l_3$.
$x_1=j_1$ romantically pursues $x_2=j_2$.
rows.n: Unlike {jersi}, implies volition for x1 but not necessarily x2. Does not imply "x1 pampe'o x2".

rows.d: $j_1$ hugs/embraces $j_2$ with $j_3$ (part of $j_1$) at locus $j_4$ (part of $j_2$).
$x_1$ is the morphology of language $x_2$ for text $x_3$.
rows.n: Morphology is the grammar for the structure of words. Note: in Lojban, morphology and grammar are, technically, conflated.

rows.d: $c_1=p_1$ lovingly looks at/views/regards/watches/gazes at $c_2=p_2$
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {catlu}, {prami}

rows.d: $x_1$ experiences so-called 'heartache'/love-pain.
rows.n: Possibly also includes love-sickness; so long as the experience is a psychological/emotional 'pain', anguish, grief, or other form of relatively intense discomfort derived from some form of love/limerence.

rows.d: $c_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits romantic orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
$t_1$ is the pattern/shape of word $v_1=t_2$ with meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$.
rows.g: form of word;pattern of word;shape of word;word form;word pattern;word shape

rows.d: $c_1$ is a dishwasher (machine).
$l_1$ (agent) washes dishes $l_2$ of soil/contaminant $l_3$ with cleaning material(s) $l_4$
$x_1=l_1$ is a dictionary with words $x_2=l_2=v_1$  in order $x_3=l_3$, medium $x_4=l_4$, and language $x_5=v_3$.
$x_1$ (object) feels like (via touch) it has property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$ (observer)
$s_1$=$v_1$ (quote) is a linguistic/conceptual lexeme for word/concept $v_2$, being the most basic subunit of $s_2$, in language $v_3$
rows.n: x1 may not be a proper word on its own (may require error/foreign/rafsi quotes or the like). See also: {veljvo}, {rafsi}.

rows.d: $x_1=v_1=s_1$ is a word/set of words (able to be) recalled by $x_2=s_2$ about subject $x_3=s_3$; $x_1$ is the vocabulary retrieved by $x_2$.
rows.n: From {valsi} {selmo'i}, 'word(s)-remembered'. An attempt at translating the English word 'vocabulary'. Pedantically, refers only to the words actually remembered, rather than those that are merely retrievable. {vlamojyzilcmi} ('word-remember-set') is a potentially more accurate translation of the English word.

rows.d: $x_1$ is an etymology of word $x_2$ meaning $x_3$ in language $x_4$
$p_1$ is a string in character set $l_2$ representing word $v_1$ meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$
rows.n: also $p_1$ is a spelling for $v_1$. See {lerpoi}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a set of words that occur together meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$; $x_1$ is a collocation

$x_1$ is the similarity relation between all members of set $x_2$ (set of quoted words) such that they all mean esentially one common thing $x_3$ and are considered to be identical in any meaningful way in language $x_4$.
rows.n: Members of $x_2$ need to be formally different words (could be expressed in IPA or careful pronunciation); some of them may not be, as transcribed, proper words in the language. If a language lacks a minimal pair which distinguishes paired phonés, then any strings which nominally differ in only such pairs will belong to $x_2$ of this word in that language; in other words allophonic but not phonemic differences produce such similarities. But even with minimal pairs, some words may not be distinguishable. This word refers to indistinguishability in the form of a word as well as its meaning/usage; so, homophones are not necessarily similar in this sense, nor are synonyms. The combination of both qualities does produce such similarities in spoken English (not necessarily written English, since the orthography is not phonemic). In English, phonation duration and, in some cases, certain phonation qualities (such as tonation, voicing, nasalation, place of articulation, aspiration, etc. (again: only in some cases)) do not distinguish words. Dialectal differences usually produce such similarities too (a U.S. English speaker and a UK English speaker will say the word "car" differently but will agree about everything concerning it, including its rhyming qualities in their dialects, its meaning, and its spelling). In Lojban, phonation duration (such as ".{yyy} " versus merely ".{y} "; but notice that some transcriptions are interpreted as producing multiphthongs/glides/syllabification, so ".{iii} " is distinct from mere ".{i} ") and minor differences in place of articulation (trilled "r" versus English "r", for example) and sometimes voicing (for nasals, rhotics, laterals, and presently xy) do not produce word distinctions; so, they will generate such similarities in Lojban. Additionally any pair of words which come into {gimkamsmikezypro} (or similar for {zi'evla}) in Lojban have such a similarity in Lojban.

$n_1$ is a fight/battle in which $d_1$ fights $d_2$ over issue $d_3$ (abstract).
$x_1$ (nu) is an event in which $x_2$ teaches $x_3$ facts $x_4$ (du'u) about $x_5$ by means $x_6$; $x_1$ is a lesson given by $x_2$ to $x_3$.

rows.d: $x_1=n_1$ is an event of $x_2=c_1$ being grateful/thankful of/appreciative of $x_3=c_2$ for $x_4=c_3$ (event/property)

rows.n: A launcher is a computer program which starts another computer program, possibly setting some launch options before doing so.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the state of $x_2$'s lack of $x_3$; $x_1$ is the event/situation in which $x_2$ lacks $x_3$.
$n_1$ is the killing by $c_1$ of $c_2$ by action/method $c_3$.
$n_1$ is a conversation involving $c_1$(s)  (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) about topic/subject $c_2$.
$x_1$ (event) is the event of cosmic/spatial inflation of universe/space $x_2$
rows.n: Various technical issues should be considered when employment of this word is being considered.  For example: only (spaital, at least three-dimensional) volume is considered, rapid and great increase is not necessarily implied, no single event is implied, the space itself is expanding and into what is not clear, etc.

rows.d: $x_1$ orders the impeachment trial of $x_2$ over issue $x_3$ within body/by judge/in system/via proceedings $x_4$; $x_1$ formally impeaches (pseudo-legalistic political process) authority $x_2$ for alleged inadequacies $x_3$.
rows.n: $x_2$ must be some sort of person with or figure of authority; impeachment does not imply criminal trial and is usually an internal process by one part of the government/organization against another with the primary consequences (upon conviction) of a forced loss of said authorities and potential prohibition from regaining certain authorities within the same government/organization. This word does not imply conviction or removal or any other punishment or effect whatsoever. $x_5$ is wide enough to include the process and capacity in which the impeachment is made and the means by which it would be tried.

rows.d: $x_1$=$g_1$ (agent) is the agentive cause/intentionally (limited sense) in shipwreck $x_2$=$nbp_1$ (event); $x_1$ shipwrecks/wrecks ship in event $x_2$
rows.n: The ship being wrecked can be specified in x2.

rows.d: $x_1$=$n_1$ (event) is a shipwreck/breaking of ship/boat $x_2$=$s_1$=$b_1$ in which it function/capability $x_3$=$s_2$ is compromised/ruined/damaged
$x_1$=$r_1$ is the physical cause of shipwreck (event) $x_2$=$nbp_1$=$r_2$ under conditions $x_3$=$r_3$
$n_1$ is an event of $b_1$ being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.

$n_1$ is an rhetoric event/speech/rhetorical performance by  $b_1=c_1$ (agent) verbally expressing $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$, good/beneficial/nice for $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x1=n1=t1$ is a village/[rural town] of area $x2=n2=t2$, in political unit $x3=t3$, serving hinterland/region $x4=t4$
$p_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $p_2$ (event), expected likelihood $p_3$ (0-1); $p_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $p_2$ (event) to be $p_3$.
rows.n: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether nulpa'a means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although nulpa'a never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. nulpa'a with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is visible to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$

rows.d: $x_1$ is indifferent towards $x_2$.

rows.d: $x_1$ is greater or equal to zero by amount $x_2$; $x_1$ is a positive number (greater than zero)

$x_1$ is a Sunday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.

rows.n: x3 can be used in order to specify cosmetic/removable singularity, pole (and the degree/severity thereof), and essential singularity; none of these aforementioned options are a default. x1 may be at infinity or in various other spaces.

rows.d: $x1$=$t2$ is an element in the set that underlies structure/ring $x2$≈$s3$ that is nilpotent in that structure with nilpotency $x3$=$t3$ (nonnegative integer according to the typical rules)
rows.n: x3 is the minimum positive exponent such that x1 multiplied by itself that many times (according to the definition of multiplication imposed by and endowing structure x2) is identically the zero(-like) element in that structure; any greater power will likewise be zero(-like). The zero(-like) element is itself trivially nilpotent with nilpotency 1. Warning: This word is for nilpotent elements. Nilpotent groups, for example, should not be referred to by this word except when considered as whole objects that participate as elements in some larger structure. See also:  {nonsmi}

rows.d: $x1$ is a zero-divisor partnered with element(s) $x2$ in structure/ring $x3$
rows.n: x1 and x2 are elements of the set underlying x3 and x1*x2=0 in this structure x3 (where "0" denotes the 'additive' identity of the structure ("addition" merely being (one of) its commutative group operation(s))); the aforementioned partnership is so defined. Unlike many textbook definitions, this definition still allows such 0 to itself be a zero-divisor ((so partnered) with any element in the set underlying x3) in x3. See also: {narnonsmikemnonsmipi'i}

rows.d: $x1$ is the zero(-like)/additive identity of structure/ring $x2$; often is denoted by ' $0_R$ '  (for structure/ring R, specified by $x2$) or by  '0' when context is obvious
rows.n: Definition and rules may be specified in the second terbri; this definition does not suppose that the ring is not the 0-ring  (the trivial ring) with the mapping of all multiplications to 0 (in which case, the additive identity is also the multiplicative identity). The usage of "additive" and "multiplicative" in this context are defined by the ring. See also: {pavysmi}

$x_1$ [possibly dimensionful number] is the local density/concentration of/in $x_2$ (object) per unit $x_3$ at locus $x_4$, of density type $x_5$; $x_2$ measures $x_1$ units of $x_5$ per unit $x_3$ at locus $x_4$.
rows.n: $x_5$ might typically refer to count - not mass. Not necessarily (although possible) volumetric mass density; could be temporal, per unit area, per unit length, or other ($x_3$); could be non-mass-based (such as for electric charge or probability densities; $x_5$); relative concentration would be a count density ($x_5$) per count of another substance ($x_3$). Can be applied to number/count; thus, the units may vary and in fact the quantity might even be unitless. In a sense, intensities and fluxes are spacial-temporal densities. It is recommended that $x_2$ be a physical entity/object/field or probability distribution in some sense (not merely have physical quality/meaning/value); thus, while this word could be applied to many things described with the word "per", it would probably not make much sense to call velocity a temporal displacement density (although in some contexts it might). Notice that "local" implies derivatives (Calculus differentiation).

$x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the magnitude of the vector of the differintegral (with respect to time) of order $x_2$ of the displacement of $x_3$ (object/point) relative to $x_4$ (object/point/frame of reference; contextless default: origin) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_5$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_6$, where the differintegral is taken with starting point $x_7$, in metric/by definition $x_8$
rows.n: This word uses three experimental gismu (with one experimental short cmavo for one of these): {nicfa} (-nif-), {salri}, {cusna}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (vector) is the differintegral (with respect to time) of order $x_2$ of the displacement of $x_3$ (object/point) relative to $x_4$ (object/point/frame of reference; contextless default: origin) in coordinate system/frame of reference/as measured by $x_5$ according to definition/standard/(meta)physics $x_6$, taken with starting point $x_7$
rows.n: This word uses two experimental gismu (one with an experimental rafsi): {nicfa} and {salri}. If x2 is negative, then x1 is a time-derivative (velocity, acceleration, jerk, etc. (for whole number values)); if it is positive, then x1 is a time-integral (moments); if it is 0, then x1 is displacement itself. The first and last options are the most common. All differintegrals are based on displacement, rather than one of its differintegrals. x1 is vector-valued.

rows.d: $m_1$ is very/extremely violent.
$g_1$ (agent) tidies/cleans up/neatens/straightens $c_1$ in property/quantity $c_2$ (ka/ni).
$s_1=v_1$ is a blizzard/snowstorm at place/region $x_2$.
$x_1$ (sequence) is a sorted sequence, ordered by relation $x_2$ (binary ka), from unordered set/plurality $x_3$
rows.n: Same place structure as {porsi}, but specifies that the sequence has been sorted according to some rule. See {cnici}, {porganzu}, {pormei}, {pormoi}

rows.d: $x1=v1=m1$ dashes to $x2=m2$ from $x3=m3$ via $x4=m4$
$x_1=n_1$ (idea/fact/du'u) suggests/intimates that $x_2=n_2=s_2$ (idea/fact/du'u) is true as it appears to $x_3=s_3$
rows.n: From {nibli} {stidi}. Unlike {stidi}, it refers to person's internal logical reasoning about facts, not external suggestion.

rows.d: $l_1$ is an implicit-abstraction lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor [tanru] $l_4$.
rows.n: The term “implicit-abstraction lujvo” is specific to Lojban and originates from The Lojban Reference Grammar, chapter 12, section 13.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a group of mob
$j_1$ concludes that $n_1$ (du'u) logically implies $n_2$ under rules $n_3$.
$x_1$ is a submarine for carrying $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a tornado/whirlwind

$x_1$ = $v_1$ = $j_1$ is a quantity of putty (viscous/thick semisolid-semiliquid) of composition $x_2$ = $j_2$, viscous/thick under conditions $x_3$ = $v_2$; $x_1$ is putty (or has the texture/characteristics thereof)
$x_1$ is mistletoe of species/variety $x_2$.
$x1$=$t1$=$n1$ is underwear, worn by/on $x2$=$t2$, for purpose $x3$=$t3$, worn under $x4$=$n2$
$x_1$ is a pair of underpants
$k_1=n_1$ is a hallway / indoor street within $k_2=n_2$ accessing $k_3$.
$n_1=k_1$ enters $n_2=k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$x_1$ is an entrance/entry/entryway/inlet/way in to $x_2$ for $x_3$ .
$m_1$ is an internal combustion engine (ICE) driving/propelling/providing power to x2,  in which combusting/burning of $j_1$ takes place internally.
$x_1$ puts/inserts $x_2$ in $x_3$
$x_1$ is mucus produced by organ/membrane $x_2$ in body $x_3$
$c_1$ is a singlet/undershirt/vest of material $c_2$.
$x_1=b_1=n_1$ enters [becomes inside-of] $x_2=n_2$ under conditions $x_3=b_3$
$x_1$ imports $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ via $x_5$ .
$x_1$ is inside out
$x_1$ is a mane on $x_2$
$x_1$ unlawfully copulates with $x_2$, unlawful according to $x_3$; $x_1$ fornicates / commits adultery with $x_2$
$r_1$ is a mitochondrion of $r_2=s_1=j_1$
$x_1$ accuses $x_2$ of charge/crime $x_3$ before judge/authority $x_4$.
$x_1=m_1=c_1$ is lethargic, slow to do $x_2=m_2$.
$x_1$ gives $x_2$ to $x_3$ to reward them for satisfying $x_4$ (ka).
$s_1=n_1$ recommends $s_2=n_2$ to audience $s_3$.
$n_1$ is most fond of $n_2=t_1$ (object/state) from set $t_4$, due to extreme $t_3$ (ka; default ka zmadu).
rows.n: Cf. {nelci}, {traji}, {plicu'a}. Also: $n_1$ likes/prefers $n_2=t_1$ the most out of set $t_4$.

rows.d: $z_1$, more than $z_2$, likes $n_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$c_1$ is a/the mucous gland secreting mucus $c_2$, of body $c_3$.
$t_1$ is an airport in transport system $t_2$ for aircraft of type $v_2$ propelled by $v_3$
$x_1=n_1=z_1$ likes $x_3=n_2$ more than $x_2=z_2$ does, by margin $x_4=z_4$.
$s_1$ is a paratrooper in military unit $s_2$.
$s_1$ maneuvers/pilots/is a pilot of aircraft $v_1=s_2$.
$j_1$ is a necktie made of material $d_2$ worn by $c_2$.
$ci_1=cn_2=v_1$ is a heron/egret/bittern of species $ci_2$
rows.n: Members of family Ardeidae are noted for flying with their necks folded.

rows.d: $k_1$ is a collar/necklace around neck $k_2=c_1$ and is made of material $k_3$.
rows.n: Could refer to collar for pets, or as a decorative thing.

rows.d: $k_1$ is a guillotine/executioner's axe for beheading $k_2$.
$cr_1=s_1$ is a polo-neck garment of material $cr_2$.
rows.n: Usually a sweater ({nivycreka}), with a close-fitting, round, and high collar that folds over and covers the neck. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: epcrka. Cf. {creka}.

rows.d: $j_1$ is the axis (cervical vertebra) of $c_2$
$x_1$ is a swan (genus Cygnus)  of species/strain $x_2$
$cr_1=d_1$ is a halter top of material $cr_2$.
rows.n: A subtype of "tube top" ({jancaucreka}), with a single strap around the back of the neck. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: ebdrka. Cf. {creka}.

rows.d: $c_1=v_2$ departs with an airplane from $c_2$ via route $c_3$.
$b_1$ is an aircraft carrier carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$.
$f_1$ is guilty of crime $f_2=z_1$ accountable to judge/authority $f_3=z_2$.
$x_1$ is a gangster
$z_1$ is a nanobot performing function $z_2$ under conditions $z_3$.
$m_1=n_1$ is $m_2=n_2$ nanometer(s) / billionth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3=n_3$ by standard $x_4=m_3$.
$t_1$ is a guest star with stellar properties $t_2$
$x_1$ is the word with stands for the number $x_2$ in language $x_3$
rows.n: E.g. Lojban {pa}, {re}, etc., English "one", "two", etc. See {nacyuensni}

rows.d: $s_1$ is a sperm of man/male humanoid person $n_1=s_2$.
$x_1$ is approximately equal to $x_2$.
$c_1=v_2$ invites $ c_3=v_1$ to $v_2$ (place/event) in manner $c_4$.
$x_1$ (agent) forgets to do $x_2$ (ka)
$s_1$ is a nationalist political ideology as applied by $t_1=p_1$ among/in people/territory/domain $t_2$ based on the works of thinker $s_3$
$p_1$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards the nation/ethnic group $n_2$; $p_1$ is a patriot/nationalist.
$x_{1}$ is a convex curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is convex. Concave: {zorkru}. See also: {ze'o}, {kruvi}, {konvexi}.

rows.d: $s_1$ gives advice $z_2$ to $s_3=z_1$.
$d_1=r_1$ is an animal of species $d_2$ and not a human; $d_1=r_1$ is a non-human animal.
rows.n: Sometimes, in colloquial usage, the word “animal” is understood to exclude humans. “naryremda'u”, rather than “{danlu}” is the correct translation of it. See also: {na}, {remna}.

rows.d: $k_1$ (non-experiencer) is unable to taste under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$k_1$ is blind/unable to see under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ (property) is satisfied by at least one thing among $x_2$ (plural)
$k_1$ is deaf/unable to hear under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$t_1$ disobeys/does not follow the command/rule $t_2$ made by $t_3$; (adjective:) $t_1$ is disobedient.
$k_1$ (non-experiencer) is unable to feel [sensory stimulus] under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$k_1$ is unable to smell/scent (transitive verb) under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1=k_1=j_1$ is unable to move/paralyzed in body-part $x_2=k_2=j_2=s_2$, under conditions $x_3=k_3=j_3$
rows.n: Transient or permanent (but not pseudo-)paralysis (see {sipyjitri'ufri} for sleep paralysis). Cf. {narte'ugaska'e}, {narviska'e}, {nartinka'e}, {narvu'igaska'e}, {narsumnyka'e}, {narka'e}.

rows.d: $g_1$ (agent) disconnects computer $j=1=s_1$ from computer $j_2=s_1$ in medium $j_3$.
rows.n: Network connection. $x_4$ could be, for example, a cable or network. Cf. {narsamjo'e}.

rows.d: Computer $j=1=s_1$ is disconnected from [not connected to] computer $j_2=s_1$ via medium $j_3$.
rows.n: Absense of a network connection over $x_3$. $x_3$ could be, for example, a cable or network. See also: {samjo'e}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (event) causes jamais-vu to $x_2$ (person) using sense $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$
$x_1$ is useless to agent $x_2$ by the standard of purpose $x_3$
$p_1$ is unique/unequaled/unparalleled/unmatched / the only one of its kind.
$x1$ is a zero-divisor partnered with element(s) $x2$ in structure/ring $x3$, where neither $x1$ nor $x2$ is the zero(-like) element in $x3$
rows.n: Let structure x3 have commutative group substructure that we name as "additive" and let "0" denote the additive identity thereof in the structure x3. In the set underlying x3 there exist elements x1, x2 ≠ 0 in structure  x3 such that x1*x2 = 0 in structure x3; the partnership aforementioned is thusly defined. See also: {nonsmipi'i}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (property) is not shared by everything among $x_2$ (plural)
$x_1$ lacks property $x_2$.
$k_1$ is unable to do/be/uncapable of doing/being $k_2$ (event/state) under conditions $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is an unknown value/argument, unknown to $x_2$
$p_1$ is a screenshot showing $p_2$, made by $p_3$ (user), in medium $p_4$.
$x_1$ is dirty laundry worn by $x_2$ for purpose $x_3$, dirty with $x_4$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is not true by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_2$
rows.n: Synonymous to {jitfa} under binary truth value logics; may otherwise have a different meaning (e.g. fuzzy logic).

rows.d: $s_1$ is a pixel of screen $s_2=v_1$.
under conditions $x_2$, it is not possible that $x_1$ (event/state/property) doesn't happen / $x_1$ necessarily happens
$x_1$ (event) is not a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to not happen
rows.n: Probably synonymous with "se cumki". See also {banzu}, {cumki}.

rows.d: under conditions $x_2$, it is possible that $x_1$ (event/state/property) doesn't happen
$x_1$ (event) is a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to not happen
$x_1$ (event) is an event that doesn't happen/occur/take place
$x_1$ (agent)'s action results in the unintended result $x_2$
$x_1$ (agent)'s action results in the unintended result $x_2$
$x_1$ wants $x_2$ to not happen, for purpose $x_3$.
rows.n: This is usually what one ought say when they say "I don't want you to do that!" Really, one means to say that they want the listener to *not* do something. The desire is affirmative, but the object of desire is negative. See {djica}.

rows.d: $p_1$ is a (ethical) vegan, not using animal products $c_2$.
rows.n: See also lacto-ovo-vegetarian (={nalre'ucti}), dietary vegan (={stagycti}), ovo-vegetarian (={sovjvestagycti}), lacto-vegetarian (={ladjvestagycti}), herbivore (={spacti}).

rows.d: $x_1=s_1=c_1$ (object/event/idea) is impossible to describe under conditions $x_2=c_2$ to audience $x_3=s_3$; $x_1$ is ineffable
rows.n: Indescribeable because of taboo/incommunicable nature (e.g. qualia). Cf. {narcu'i}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (event/state/property) is impossible under condition $x_2$
$x_{1}$ in motion/active.
rows.n: A change in position is not implied. “idling” (not moving), is the negation of this: {cando}.

rows.d: $cab_1=can_1$ (device/apparatus) is on / operational.
$g_1$ (agent) turns device/apparatus $cab_1=can_1$ on.
rows.n: See also: turn off (={ca'arcadgau}), turned on (={narca'acando}).

rows.d: $x_1$ (event) is insufficient / is not a sufficient condition for $x_2$ to happen
$x_1=c_2$ completely fills the display of monitor/screen $x_2=c_1=v_1$; $x_1=c_2$ is “in fullscreen”.
rows.n: $x_1=c_2$ is not very specific here. It could refer, for example, to a computer program ({samtci}), a window ({pevyca'o zei uidje}), a movie ({skina}) or something else.

rows.d: $j_1=v_1$ (video monitor/screen) displays $j_2$ to $j_3$; $j_2$ is the display of monitor $j_1=v_1$ shown to $j_3$.
$x_1$ is southeast by east of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$z_1=c_1$ is a southeast African/Transvaal lion [Panthera leo krugeri] of breed $c_2$.
$x_1$ is southeast of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is southwest of $x_2$ in frame of reference $x_3$.
$x_1$ is South Slavic/Yugoslavian in aspect $x_2$.
rows.n: South Slavic if the aspect is language, else Yugoslavian; see also {slovino}, {bolgaro}, {slovo}, {serbo} (experimental)

rows.d: $x_1$ is south by west of $x_2$ in reference frame $x_3$.
$z_1=c_1$ is a southwest African/Katanga lion [Panthera leo bleyenberghi] of breed $c_2$.

$s_1$=$c_1$ is a linguistic-gesture unit/chereme [in analogy with phoneme; specifically, nonvocal] representing/that is recognized meaningful conceptual subunit underlying specific gestures/gesture-phones $s_2$ in language $b_1$ used by $b_2$ in order to communicate/express $b_3$=$c_2$ (si'o/du'u; not quote) made using body part/utensil/tool/locus $c_3$ by motion/action/means $c_4$
rows.n: From {bangu} {corci} (here non-vocal) {selci}. $x_2$ is a recognized/represented by (belongs to equivalence class of) chereme $x_1$. The chereme may not have meaning on its own but must be expressive naturally and/or in that language (as a gesture and phoneme is, respectively). See also {banvoksle}, {xancrcereme}, {lercorci}, {cocle'u}, {corci}, {xanle'u}, {xanle'ule'u}, {xanbau}, {saskrcereme}

rows.d: $b_1=c_1$ is a bullock [young male cattle/beef-producer/bovine], of age $n_2$ immature/defined as a bullock by standard $n_3$, of species/breed $b_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) increases/increments/augments $x_2=z_1$ in property/quantity $x_3=z_2$ by amount $x_4=z_3$.
$x_1$ is South Africa.
$x_1$ is the South African English language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ increases/augments $x_2$ (experiencer) in property/quantity $x_3$ by amount $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a bluff oak (Quercus austrina) of species/strain $x_2$.
$g_1=v_1$ is poison gas under conditions $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Central American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$v_2=l_3$ is trash/rubbish/garbage/refuse removed from $v_3=l_2$ by $v_1=l_1$ (agent)
$x_1=n_2$ is pateint about $n_1=x_2$ under conditions $n_3=x_3$
$x_1=k_1=n_2$ [agent] tries to solve puzzle/enigma/riddle/charade $x_2=k_2=n_1$ in game/contest $x_3=n_3$
$d_1$ is a bread knife with a blade of material $d_3$.
$v_1=r_1$ cuts (removes during editing) $v_2=r_2$ from $v_3$ leaving $v_4$.
$x_1$ is absent from $x_2$.
$x_1$ is unremorseful of $x_2$.
$x_1$ tolerates $x_2$ (event) under conditions $x_3$
$x_1$ is unrepentant of $x_2$.
$p_1$ is a free-diver.
$j_1=c_1=v_1$ (object/person) is free-diving beneath/below/under from $c_2$ (object/water surface) in frame of reference $c_3$, submerged in liquid $j_2$.
$x_1$ is any referent of $x_2$ ; $x_2$ has a set of referents, but the difference between the members of the set is not important
rows.n: One possible interpretation of {xe'e}. (xe'ere lo mu plise) → (re nalvaimenre be lo mu plise); (xe'ere plise) → (re nalvaimenre be ro plise). See {le'elkai}, {itca}, {menre}. Shortening: {nalvaime}

rows.d: $x_1$ (event/person) is unimportant/insignificant to $x_2$ (event/person) due to/in aspect $x_3$; $x_2$ doesn't care about $x_1$'s $x_3$-ness.
rows.n: I found myself saying [{na'e} {vajni}] very often and thus thought that it'd be nice to have a lujvo for it.

rows.d: $x_1$ is an eraser word
rows.n: This corresponds to selma'o SI, SA and SU in Lojban.

rows.d: $c_1=t_1$ is withdrawn, feeling emotion $c_2$ about $c3=t_3$ from $t_2$.
$s_1$ (agent) is relentless/unceasing in activity/process/state $s_2$.
$s_1$ is dishonest/disingenuous to $s_2$ about $s_3$.
$f_1=n_1$ is unmarried under law/custom/tradition $s_3$.
$x_1$ (event/state) is unhindered by $x_2$ (event/state) due to quality $x_3$ (ka).
$x_1$ is raw/crude/unprocessed
$r_2$ is calm/untroubled about $r_1$ with result $r_3$.
$x_1$ is wingless/has no wings.
$x_1$ is wingless/has no wings.
$j_2$ is uncooked/raw.
$x_1=c_2$ is uninterested in $x_2=c_1$.

$t_1=c_1$ is afraid of saying syllable(s) $c_2=sl_1$ of language $sl_2$ to $c_3$ via $c_4$ because they believe that saying them is not necessary for continuing state/process $sa_2$ under conditions $sa_3$
$x_1$ is unconscious/not aware of $x_2$ (object/abstract).
rows.n: This is unconsciousness wrt a specific thing ($x_2$); widen for generalized unconsciousness. This may more or less include (some aspects of) sleep, but sleep is a very specific and complex process, and most forms of unconsciousness do not function in a manner which is even remotely similar to sleep. This is NOT "subconscious" in many meanings or contexts. See also: {sipna}.

rows.d: $r_1$ (NU) is casual, not formal/ceremonial.
$c_1$ does not eat meat $c_2=r_1$; $c_1$ is a (lacto-ovo-)vegetarian.
rows.n: See also (ethical) vegan (={nardalprapli}), dietary vegan (={stagycti}), ovo-vegetarian (={sovjvestagycti}), lacto-vegetarian (={ladjvestagycti}), herbivore (={spacti}).

rows.d: $x_1$ is a non-human animal of species/taxon $x_2$
rows.n: This is frequently what is meant by just "animal" in English. See also {danlu}.

rows.d: $c_1=t_1$ in activity/state $c_2$ exhibits/performs/expresses non-binary gender $c_3=t_2$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: $x_1$ exhibits/performs/expresses a gender that does not adhere to a binary gender norm/standard. Cf. {reltracinse} (binary gender). See {tracinse} for definition of gender.

rows.d: $n_1$ (li) is an integer number that is not a multiple of two by an integer; $n_1$ is an odd number.
$x_1$ is an odd number (integer not divisible by 2).
$g_1=r_2$ is tranquil/happy about $g_2=r_1$.
$r_1$ leaves $r_2$ alone/in peace.
$x_1$ does not repeat/reoccur/recur; $x_1$ only happens once.
rows.g: happen once;happens once;not happen again;not recur;not reoccur;one-time;one-time event;one-time occurrence

rows.d: $x_1$ is irrelevant/unrelated to $x_2$; $x_1$ is arbitrary in relation to $x_2$ [object of comparison; context or referent].
rows.n: Also 'random' in the sense of something that is unexpected in a particular context. Does not mean 'random' in the sense of patternless or unpredictable (the primary sense of {cunso}). If $x_1$ is an utterance or sign, nalra'a does NOT mean that it is entirely meaningless ({smucau}), but that it does not provide any outward indication of what thing it signifies if its meaning is not already known. See also {srana}, {sinxa}, {smuni}, {ckini}, {mifra}, {ckaji}. Derivative words include {nalra'aselkai} 'arbitrariness', {nalra'acme} 'arbitrary name', {sranycme} 'nonarbitrary name', {smura'asni} 'sign whose form is related to or indicates its referent'.
rows.g: arbitrary;irrelevant;out of place;out-of-place;out of place in;out-of-place in;random;unassociated;unassociated with;unconnected;unexpected;unnecessary;unrelated;unrelated to

rows.d: $p_1$ gives consent/agreement/sanction to $p_2$ (person/force ind./mass) about $p_3$ (abstract).
$x_1$ is a human who is neither a woman nor a man.
rows.g: neither man nor woman;non-binary-gendered humanoid person

rows.d: $n_1$ is not a number
$x_1=j_1$ thinks that $x_2=n_1$ and $x_3=n_2$ (du'u) may both be true about $x_4=j_3$, on grounds $x_5=j_4$; $x_1$ thinks that $x_2$ and $x_3$ are logically compatible.
$x_1$ is incomplete/unfinished in property $x_2$ by standard $x_3$ .
$s_1$ is an approximant consonant with place of articulation $m_2=m_3$ and phonation $x_3$.
$m_1$ forgets fact/memory $m_2$ about subject $m_3$.
rows.n: Cf. {na'e}, {morji}, {tolmo'i}.  Assumes that {morji} refers to a state i.e. 'remember'= 'retain in memory'.

rows.d: $m_{1}$ is ugly to $m_{2}$ in aspect $m_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $m_{4}$.
$m_1$ is not less than/more than or equal to $m_2$ in property/quantity $m_3$ (ka/ni) by amount $m_4$
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {na'e}, {mleca}, {zmadu}

rows.d: $p_2=t_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of amorphous carbon.
$c_1=x_1$ is a quantity of decaffinated coffee/coffee [beverage] without caffeine.
$k1$ is unable to do/be/uncapable of doing/being (event/state) $k2$ under conditions $k3$ (event/state)
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {na'e}, {kakne}

rows.d: $d1$ does not knows fact(s) $d2$ (du'u) about subject $d3$ by epistemology $d4$
rows.n: This is the proper meaning of agnostic: gnostic - knowledge, a - without. The word is not limited to just religion, and does not describe a position of belief, although it can be used in this context: agnostic theism, agnostic atheism, etc.

rows.d: $j_1$ is inattentive towards/distracted from object/affair $j_2$.
$dji_1=dju_1$ desires/wants/wishes unknown era $dji_2=c_1=dju_3$ (event/state) characterized by $c_2$ (event/property/interval/idea) for purpose $dji_3$. $dji_1=dju_1$ is nostalgic.
rows.n: Typically refers to the melancholy desire to live out an era that happened before the subject was born, or to live in a place where one has never been.

rows.n: All tobacco and tobacco-based products, but not merely nicotine-based products (e.g. pharmaceutical), not intended for smoking e.g. dipping/chewing/dissolvable tobacco, snuff, snus, tobacco gum, iqmik, naswar, gutka, toombak, shammah, etc. Cf. {tanko}, {danmo}, {sigja}.

rows.n: A member of taxon Pterygota. Includes stages and morphs without wings. See {cinki}, {nalci}, {vofli}.

$x_1$ is a male teacher of sexuality to audience $x_2$.

rows.n: In a gender binary, this word covers half of each heterosexuality and homosexuality. It is not strict (in other words, bisexuals are both male- and female-attracted). Could be useful for transexuals with a definite preference, as well. See also: {fetytricinse}

rows.d: $x_1$ is a husband of $x_2$ (spouse) according to marriage law/custom/tradition $x_3$.
$c_2$ is semen containing $s_1$, secreted by organism $c_1$=$s_2$
$x_1$ is a gamete of male $x_2$
$si_1$ is feminism, the idea that females and males are alike in quality $sm_3$, as thought by $si_2$.
$x_1 = t_2$ is attracted to males in property/manner/capacity $x_2 = t_3$ (ka), where maleness is determined by evincing masculine traits/according to standard $x_3 = n_3$ (ka).
rows.n: $x_2$ can be used in order to indicate romantic attraction, sexual attraction, etc., among other things; for the most part, similar-species-ness is assumed, so use $x_2$ in order to indicate alternatives (such as a human being attracted to male cats for pets). This word does not exclude the possibility of being attracted to non-males in any manner or property, including the one given for this $x_2$. In the context of $x_2$ = lo ka gletu, this word includes heterosexual females (assuming gender binary), homosexual males, bisexual and pansexual people, male-attracted trans people, etc.
rows.g: attracted to males;attracted to men;like men

rows.d: $p_1$ is a/the penis of $p_2=n_1$.
$x_1=t_1$ is boxer shorts/boxer briefs/briefs/jockstrap (male genital underwear), serving purpose $x_2=t_3$
rows.n: Male genitalia/crotch/penis-covering type of underwear. Needn't be worn by male/man/boy but garment need be made for male genitalia/pubic region in some manner (see {fetpibyta'u}/{pibyta'u} for female/non-defined counterpart). Cf. {nerta'u}, {taxfrbikini}, {tatyta'u}.
rows.g: boxerbriefs;boxer briefs;boxers;boxer shorts;briefs;g-string;jockstrap;loose boxers;male undergarment;male underwear;string;tanga;thong;tight boxers

rows.n: This word is about male homosexuality and bisexuality. See also {nakcinse}, {fetfetcinse}, {mitcinse}, {relcinse}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is an uncle of $x_2$
$c_1$ is androphilous [sexually attracted to men] in situation $c_2$ by standard $c_4$.
rows.n: This word is only about sexual interest in males; other sexuals interest are irrelevant. See also {fetcinse}, {naknakcinse}, {mitcinse}, {dutcinse}.

rows.d: $c_1$ is a god (specifically, male deity) of people(s)/religion $c_2$ with dominion over $c_3$ [sphere].
rows.n: In English, "god" can be either genderless or male (depending on context and contrast), while specifically indicating a female deity by use of the word "goddess". In order to correct this imbalance, Lojban is equipped with {fetcei} and {nakcei} (among other words) for the variously characterized deities, whereas {cevni} makes no implications about the gender of the deity. Cf. {fetcei}, {nakni}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {krici}, {censa}, {malsi}. Recommended to be used only use when contrasted with {fetcei} or masculinity of the deity is to be emphasized/important.

rows.d: $x_1$ is the abstract color orange
rows.n: The gismu {narju} refers to objects which are orange, but not the color orange itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

rows.n: The Linnaean binomial Nelumbo nucifera (Gaertn.) is the currently recognized name for this species, which has been classified under the former names, Nelumbium speciosum (Willd.) and Nymphaea nelumbo, among others. See also {latna}.

$x_1$ is the most difficult among $x_2$
$x_1$ is more difficult/harder than $x_2$ for $x_3$ by amount $x_4$
$x_1$ (number) is the greatest element/maximum of the set (of numbers) $x_2$ under (partial) ordering $x_3$
rows.n: x1 must be a set. If this word is being used as a function ($max$), common but lazy mathematical practice allows for speaking of "the maximum of a function" (including sequences) or to constrain the maximum with respect to certain variables, but these constraints can and properly ought to be incorporated into the definition of the set of which the maximum is being taken. This word is not limited to purely mathematical usage and the set can be defined loosely (such as in "the maximum number of people whom I permit to be invited" wherein the set x2 is understood to be the set of the possible acceptable numbers of guests allowed by the speaker). The maximum x1 must belong to set x2; compare with:  {mecraizmana'u} (supremum). See also: {nacmecrai}.
